text: Memasuki kawasan Puncak panoramanya sangat indah. Receptionis menerima kami dengan baik dan ramah. Interiornya sangat mengagumkan. Kamar cukup luas dan bersih. Penataan ruangan sangat baik. Kamar mandi juga bersih. Dari dalam kamar kami bisa melihat pemandangan yang indah. Suasana sangat nyaman sehingga dapat tidur nyenyak menginap disini. Staff hotel sangat ramah dan baik. Sarapan masakannya sangat enak dan lezat. Kolam renang kondisinya baik dan menyenangkan. Menginap disini sangat terkesan sekali.
title: Panorama Sangat Indah

text: Pengalaman menginap kami di The Puncak luar biasa - kamar-kamarnya sangat besar dan akomodatif dengan gaya berkelas dan kenyamanan. Pemandangannya mempesona - hanya ada satu pasangan lain saat kami menginap di sini jadi hanya kami sendiri yang menikmati kolam renang infinity! Sarapannya sangat lengkap dan staf sangat membantu -  kami sangat menikmati koktail dan handuk dingin gratis yang diberikan kepada kami. Kami hanya menginap dua malam dan rasanya tidak ingin meninggalkan hotel ini - menu makan malamnya luar biasa. Kamu benar-benar menyarankan hotel ini!
title: Pemandangan luar biasa

text: Hotel The Puncak adalah rahasia terbaik di Indonesia. Hotel ini didekorasi dengan sangat baik, sederhana dengan hiasan dinding tengah yang terbuat dari marmer dan sangat elegan. Benar-benar tempat untuk relaksasi. Sunsetnya luar biasa dan pemandangan dari tiap kamar mempesona. Kami menginap 4 malam di sana, 8 sampai 12 Desember 2012 dan pengalaman kami benar-benar menyenangkan. JP dan Nuri adalah tuan rumah yang sangat hebat. Layanan pribadi yang mereka sediakan berkelas dunia dan yang terbaik. Saya pergi ke sana dengan pacar saya untuk merayakan ulang tahunnya dan pengalaman kami sangat mengesankan. Ada kunjungan harian yang bisa diatur ke air terjun (sangat disarankan di Rinjani) dan tempat-tempat lain. Juga ada beberapa restoran enak yang jaraknya tidak jauh jika ditempuh dengan mobil. JP, Nuri, dan staf mereka memenuhi setiap kebutuhan Anda. Sarapan yang disediakan di teras di luar kamar enak dan sangat lengkap. Makan pagi sambil menikmati pemandangan indah, sangat luar biasa. Tempat ini pasti kami kunjungi lagi. Lombok adalah tempat tujuan terbaik terbaru di Indonesia. Hotel The Puncak layak Anda masukkan dalam daftar tempat-tempat yang harus dikunjungi -  Anda TIDAK AKAN kecewa, saya jamin.
title: Rahasia terbaik Indonesia Telah Terungkap....

photos.caption: Another amazing sunset from the room

text:
Hotel indah dengan staf yang hangat dan ramah. Mereka membantu kami merencanakan seluruh perjalanan kami yang sangat menyenangkan.

Sarapannya banyak dan staf sangat peduli dengan terpenuhinya kebutuhan Anda, termasuk sewaktu-waktu menyesuaikan menu mereka atau mempersiapkan kendaraan.

Daerahnya agak terpencil, tapi ini membuatnya lebih baik untuk bisa menikmati pemandangan tanpa suara sepeda motor yang lewat setiap menit.
title: Tempat yang sangat bagus untuk berbulan madu

text: Saya menghabiskan 2 malam luar biasa di surga ini. Pemandangannya memukau, propertinya menakjubkan. Keramahtamahannya lebih dari bintang 5. Teman saya dan saya benar-benar dimanjakan oleh karyawan yang luar biasa yang sangat ramah dan bersahaja. Jean-Paul dan Nuri, sang pemilik, membuat kami merasa sangat disambut dan penting. Terima kasih kepada kalian semua untuk waktu yang luar biasa ini. Saya tidak pernah merasa sesantai dan dirawat sebaik ini dalam hidup saya. Saya pasti akan kembali.
title: Pengalaman luar biasa

text:
We have visited a lot of places over the past few years and this has been one of our favourite stays. It is in a stunning setting and the hosts, Jean-Paul and Nury, are one of the nicest couples we have ever met. They can't do enough for you. 

The hotel is based in a brilliant location, overlooking Senggigi and having the amazing backdrop of Mount Angung over the water. The sunset is guaranteed to be beautiful every night!

It was my birthday whilst we stayed and we decided to have dinner at the hotel. Nury is a great cook and we had a lovely meal, topped off with a big slice of cake! 

If you ever consider exploring Indonesia, make sure Lombok is on your list. We were previously in Singapore and Bali but this was our favourite. Mostly due to the kindness of the hosts ensuring our stay was the best it could be!

Thank you Jean-Paul and Nury, we will be sure to return in the future! :)
title: Stunning location and top hosts

text: The Puncak looks far away on the map but it's a short ride down the hill on scooter or taxi to Sengiggi. Your host is Jean-Paul from Belgium cannot do enough for you but also gives you space to be alone in this spectacular destination. Your room faces out across the beautiful infinity pool to the forever of ocean with views of the mountains of Bali. There is no sign at the bottom of the hill so the taxi driver did have difficulty to find it if he had not asked at the tourist centre for directions. Make the effort you will not be disappointed! You can buy wine or spirits in Sengiggi and take it to Puncak to drink or Jean-Paul will source it for you.
title: To get out of the mess, heat and noise you must stay here. An eternity of ocean view

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Tourist numbers are picking up after the earthquake and The Puncak is exactly where they should head to! Somewhere for a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle, nestled into the hillside with extraordinary views across the Lombok Strait to Bali and it's incredible volcano!

The room we had was immaculately clean and perfectly presented, the attention to detail was exceptional and in spite of the drop in tourist numbers the experience was fantastic. We ordered off their delivery menu and had some fabulous italian food from a nearby restaurant. The pools in-front of the rooms are cool and refreshing with one of the best views around! Resident geckos call in the evening, we saw a glimpse of an eagle as it flew up the hillside, bats and swifts/swallows/martins catching insects just outside your room. 

Jean-Paul made us feel entirely welcome and couldn't have done more for us. Excellent communication via Whatsapp as we made our way over from Gili Air made getting picked up from the harbour at Bangsal very easy. Our driver, Alan, was great and the trip was only about an hour along the coast road (Alan also runs his own tours). 

A huge thank you to Jean-Paul and Nury for their vision, guest care, dedication and resilience; you've created a beautiful place which is a restful haven for stressed out travellers!
title: Feb 2019 - One night wasn't enough...!

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
My wife and I spent three wonderful nights at this totally unique boutique hideaway high in the hills above Senggigi. Jean-Paul (JP), Nury and all the staff were incredibly welcoming and helpful. The room was immaculate. The view to the ocean, Bali and Mt Agung simply stunning. The breakfast was huge and wonderful. We also had lunch and dinner at The Puncak and all of the food was fresh and absolutely delicious. I recommend the lasagna for lunch and either spaghetti bolognese of chicken curry for dinner. The food prices are very good given the freshness and high quality of the dishes. We wanted to hire a scooter to get around, which JP organised for us very quickly. On the second evening at around 9pm we got a puncture while in Senggigi. I called JP and within 45 minutes he had arranged to have the scooter replaced with a new one so that we could continue our evening. Incredible! 
The whole ambience of The Puncak, from the uniqueness of each room to the stunningly beautiful natural surroundings, provides a wonderful spiritual renewal.
Highly recommended!
title: Absolutely stunning

text:
This is our second time in Lombok. This time we brought along our 2 teenage kids. We were there end of Sept'18 after the earthquake. Our initial plan before the earthquake was to stayed in Gili Trawangan for 3 nights before spending our last night in The Puncak before leaving for Bali. After the earthquake we decided to do a day trip to Gili T and stayed somewhr in Senggigi but stuck with our plan to stay at The Puncak which was definitely a decision we did not regret. After our rather long and adventurous escapades around Java and the island visit to Gili Trawangan, The Puncak provided a much needed sanctuary to unwind and relax. The resort itself was impressive and everything that we had expected and more, and the view was unlike anything we have seen (even comparable to that of Mt. Bromo sunrise which we experienced days before). The small thoughtful details like the universal plug and medicine was definitely that could be easily overlooked but much appreciated.

My heart felt thanks to Jean-Paul and Nury for welcoming us with such warmth and sincerity that we just could not help but feel like we were visiting old friends. And to the more-than-accommodating and helpful staff in the resort.

As Jean-Paul said before we left, "Till we meet again."
title: Great way to end our Lombok visit

text:
We arrived a few days after the main Earthquake in Lombok, in August. 
Jean-Paul is a fantastic host and really know how to look after his guests! 

The Puncak is gorgeous, the rooms beautifully designed with local black granite. The view from the hill over the Ocean and the Mount Agung in the far back. It's quiet, peaceful and perfect for Couples (no kids policy) We wish we could have stayed longer!
title: Paradise for couples

text: We planned to stay for a night and it was so good we stayed for 4 nights. A Lovely family run, small hotel where the host Jean-Paul is so passionate about your experience, a nice personal touch which you don't seem to get with some of the bigger hotels. The views over Sengiggi and over to Bali watching the sunset in one of the two infinity pools was a beautiful highlight. Also book we booked with them directly. Excellent Hotel we shall stay here again. The best hotel of our trip.
title: Beautiful hotel

text:
Great hotel nestled on top of a hill which meant amazing sunsets. It was so peaceful and it felt like we had the whole place to ourselves.  Sengiggi town is easy to get to via taxi (very inexpensive as well) or you could hire a scooter and get around very easily.

The owners, Jean-Paul and Nury made the fantastic hotel, view and facilities even more amazing. They were so helpful and gave us their personal whatsapp number so we could contact them any time if we had any questions while travelling around the island. The breakfast was also delicious with large portions and Nury is a great cook! They really went above and beyond for us.

Highly recommend you book this place. It's great value for money as well. Don't forget to check out the sunset!!
title: AMAZING SUNSETS AND AMAZING HOTEL

text:
Jane & I spent a couple of nights at the Puncak Hotel last weekend, the location on the 'Hill' has amazing views over Senggigi, you can also see Mt Agung in bali on a clear morning.. 
Its quiet tranquil location is perfect for couples to relax and take in the views.. 
there is good trek behind the hotel that takes you further up the hill, great for an hours morning walk before breakfast to take in wider views of Lombok,  you'll also bump into some of the friendly locals travelling from their villages to the town along the same trek..
the infinity pools are right in front of your room and ideal for lazing about taking in the view or doing a few early morning laps..
Breakfast out the front of your room is served by the friendly staff who's attention to detail is second to none  :)
The staff are warm, friendly & helpful with Jean Paul close by and accessible if needed. 
We had a great time & will be back in August
title: Villo & Evo's Short Tour of Lombok

text:
We were a group of friends and spent four nights at The Puncak in Lombok. The Puncak is a small boutique hotel run by a wonderful family. The setting is truly special. It is on top of the hill overlooking Senggigi and has two amazing infinity pools. The rooms were lovely and clean, but what truly made our stay was the owner's hospitality. Jean-Paul, Nury, and their daughter were incredibly kind and helpful with everything we needed and all our requests (whether day trips from the hotel or dining requests at the hotel). They truly made us feel at home. Breakfast was great as well. The rest of the staff were also all very friendly. 

The Puncak is a perfect hotel if you are looking for a small luxurious boutique hotel and the personalized touch you get from a family-run establishment. Highly recommended!
title: Perfect boutique hotel in Lombok!

text: We picked The Puncak as we wanted somewhere peaceful and quiet to relax with a distant sea view over green luscious land. Lombok is a less developed island than Bali so not so busy and this provided just what we needed. The Puncak sits high above Sengigi so taxis or a car and a driver are a must if you want to get out and about. The owners and staff were great, breakfast was plentiful, rooms spacious and two swimming pools refreshing. Sengigi offers restaurants, shops and other facilities in a less frantic pace of life. All in all a very enjoyable stay.
title: Belated honeymoon

text: Stayed at Puncak for 3 nights as part of our trip to Lombok. The hill side views, JP and the Puncak Team make this a special place. Nury does a great job in the kitchen and I would recommend having the chicken curry! Thanks JP and team for a memorable stay.

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
The Puncak situated on a steep hill just outside Sengiggi provides a spectacular setting.We stayed at The Puncak for 4 nights during our honeymoon.
This is a truly beautiful property and unique in the fact that I don't think you will find views from your bed anywhere else like this in Lombok.
During the morning and sunset on a clear day you will see Mount Agung in the distance peaking through the clouds. A truly magical view.
The hospitality provided by Jean Paul and Nury is second to none, they are always there to help but in a discreet way.
The daily breakfast was the best we had on our trip, they provide such a large varied choice with fresh ingredients. We dined on the terrace for 2 evenings and again perfectly cooked food, with an amazingly private romantic setting.
The 2 infinity pools shared between 5 rooms are fantastic and I think even if the property was full there would still be plenty of room to relax in privacy.
The rooms are nicely appointed with all the facilities you need, the bed was extremely comfortable. Bear in mind due to the location you will come across wildlife at the property.

The location of the property is great, located about 45minutes from the international airport and to get to the small town of Sengiggi is a 10 minute taxi drive, staff at the hotel will assist you with calling a taxi anytime you wish to go, taxis are also easy to pick up in the town to take you back to The Puncak.
This hotel overall is a perfect place for anyone that wants a beautiful base in Lombok in which to explore this truly stunning island and also to get away from the big brand hotels. Accommodation choices are limited on Lombok, therefore I think this hotel does have unique selling points above the rest.
A perfect place for relaxation and we are so glad we came here for our honeymoon
title: Amazing stay and hospitality

text:
The Puncak is secluded and private place with great view. It rains a lot during our stay but the sunset view was stunning ! We're the only guest staying there so it really felt like our own place. We don't feel like going outside because the place was sooo cozy. Clean room & bathroom. No trouble sleeping at all. When you woke up early, the view from the room was breathtaking. The air was so fresh compared to the smoky dusty air of Jakarta. They have clothesline in front of the room. I thought that's a nice addition to the place coz you can hang your swimsuits to dry.

They don't disturb you unless they need to confirm for tomorrow's breakfast. That's great but if you want your room cleaned, you have to tell them around noon because the cleaning service went home around 4pm. Note that there's no shaver though so my husband needs to buy one in the nearest mart. We stayed on the furthest room so the wifi was not so good in the room. We have to went outside to get the signal. 

Breakfast was great and served outside our room. More varieties on the breakfast will be great though. Jean Paul and his wife, Nury, were really helpful. We need to reschedule our stay because of family emergency and they were so helpful. Thanks for that ! They also help arranged our tour and ordering dinner. Taxi can be ordered easily here too. 

We'll surely come back here if we're ever in Lombok again.
title: Stunning view, cozy place

text: This hotel was amazing and I would recommend it to anyone. In all our time in Bali, Lombok and the Gili Islands this was our favourite hotel. Firstly you have to mention the owners, Jean Paul and His family make you feel right at home, welcoming you warmly with a glass of cool coconut water and helping you with any question or concern you may have. All the food etc.  is made fresh on site and the breakfast was by fr our favourite, there's a bit of everything! The rooms are simple but lovely, and they all open out onto the pools which are lovely. The entire place is peaceful and calm, the pool has minimal levels of chlorine in it and it has a very natural feel. There is a lovely honeymoon feel and your meals are all served outside your room which is a lovely personal touch. You can order taxis so it's easy to get connected to the centre of senggigi for dinner. If you're looking at Lombok, definitely worth a stay.
title: Perfection! Definitely stay here!!!

owner_response.text:
Dear Guests,
Dear LucyFH,

Thank you very much for your recommendation.
We are honored about your considerations.
Yes we are keen to take care with attention many issues like the breakfasts we are
trying to serve with personal attention, making from these moments an important highlight like a harmoniously sounding music instrument  inside the symphony of the whole environment ;-)
We are trying to be as Eco and nature friendly as possible and the romantic honeymoon feeling is always present.
Although we are situated near the top of a hill, access is easy and travelling around Lombok starting from The Puncak is absolutely practical because of the good strategic position whether you would like to visit the north or the south of beautiful Lombok, or having an easy connection to the Gili islands as well as to neighboring island Bali by speedboat shuttle.

Feel free to contact us directly for any practical information.

With our kindest regards,

Jean-Paul & Nury
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We stopped here for one night after a really long flight from the UK. Jean-Paul and Nury are the most friendly and welcoming people and really know how to look after their guests! The Puncak is gorgeous, the beautifully designed rooms look out over the island and have the most amazing sea view. It's quiet, peaceful and perfect. I wish we could have stayed longer!
title: Beautiful hillside retreat

owner_response.text:
Dear Guests,
Dear HawksbillTen,

Thank you very much for your great input.
It's through that 1 night stay in The Puncak is probably not enough to make our 5 senses being fulfilled :-)

We are wishing to see you back here in The Puncak during a next trip in Lombok.

For any booking or inquiry don't hesitate to contact us directly - accurate response - best conditions.


Warm regards,

Jean-Paul & Nury
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
It's easy to see why this place has won the Traveler's Choice award this year. We are very lucky to have traveled a fair bit, and hands down this is one of the best places we've stayed in.
Jean Paul and Nury are incredible hosts and their effort and passion in what they are doing is evident in every detail here. 
We stayed for 2 nights as part of a week trip in Lombok and Gili Meno. Communication prior to our arrival was helpful and informative. Check in was a personal greeting from our hosts with welcoming friendly smiles. The hotel itself has 5 rooms, all with a spectacular view, and two plunge infinity pools. It felt secluded and private, with a luxury style. The room was a great size - huge bed - and very well designed and presented. Everything was covered from shampoo and conditioner to a small first aid kit. Wifi and AC both fully functioning. All rooms have large sliding doors which make the most of the spectacular view and meant we could watch the sunrise and sunset laying in bed. 
The staff arranged taxis for us to the town for dinner, and were extremely thoughtful in their hosting of us. Service from all the staff was friendly and personal but in no way imposing. 
The breakfast - WOW! Spectacular! The menu options for lunch and dinner are also very tasty. We had the beef burger, chicken curry, pumpkin soup, salad and pineapple grill during our stay and all were delicious. 
Overall, one of our favorite experiences, and we hope to return one day.
title: Exceptional in every way

owner_response.text:
Dear Guests,
Dear PamelaDolton,

We would like to thank you for your appreciation.
Indeed we are keen to have a good communication before check-in, during your stay and even sometimes after check out. This is a good way to avoid  situations where misunderstandings could occur (transport, language,...) -   during holidays, isn't it ?

This is the reason why we are inviting potential guests to contact us directly for the most accurate information about availability - best prices - possible day trips and other activities - airport or harbor pick - we can assist in all way from you first contact with us.

Thank you for your description about The Puncak - the stunning environment - the service - the easy connection to town - the quality of our fresh and tasty menu options.

Lately we had a few different guests from Singapore, Germany and England staying back in The Puncak after a first experience a few years ago.  It is always amazing to see guests back and to listen to their experiences in between ...

We are wishing you all the best, thank you for staying with us in The Puncak, Lombok.

Kind regards,

Jean-Paul & Nury
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Having lived and worked in Asia for two years, thus having travelled a lot, I can honestly say that this is by far one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. It is located up mountain outside Senggigi, and has stunning views.

It is owned and run by an exceptionally friendly and helpful couple: Jean-Paul and Nury, who provide and incredibly warm and personal service. The food, cooked by Nury, is delicious and beautifully presented, and the complimentary breakfast is outstanding.

The rooms, which are huge and luxurious, overlook the mountain and ocean, which provide the most beautiful sunsets. The infinity pool is amazing, and there are sun-beds next to it where you can relax for the day. The whole area is calm and peaceful, and is perfect for a romantic getaway.
title: Perfection!

owner_response.text:
Dear alexn916,

Well, terimakasih (thank you) for your input here on TripAdvisor :-)
We are trying to work with our heart and sens of empathy in order to make that our guests having a memorable journey.
Holiday is only a limited amount of time and thus, if you are looking for quietness, small but efficient within a stunning and romantic environment, it would be probably a good choice to stay with us, here in The Puncak.

Again thank you for this great review.

All the best and hopefully see you soon again.


Jean-Paul & Nury
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
The Puncak (pronounced pun-chak) is INCREDIBLE!

The hosts of this small hotel are absolutely wonderful - they always went out of their way to check in on us and see if we needed any help getting around or booking things and handled getting our fast boat booked, which was very kind because we'd had trouble with boats to get to Lombok.

The hotel itself is remote, quiet, clean, beautiful, safe, and has a STUNNING view, especially from the infinity pool. It's just as beautiful as the photos, if not more. The sliding glass door gave us a wonderful view in the morning of the volcano on Bali. And the sunset from the same spot is pretty righteous!

Breakfast was delicious and plentiful (the Puncak tea is delicious!), our hosts were very accommodating to dietary needs, and the dinner we had there when we were too tired to get a taxi down ($4 USD maybe) was cooked divinely.

I really can't recommend it more if you're looking for something a little different and perhaps romantic near Senggigi.
title: Beauty on the Hill

owner_response.text:
Dear Guests,
Dear Katie O,

We are thanking you for the time you took to talk about your experience with us.
Indeed we are always keen to have an accurate and practical response in order to make our guests having a memorable experience. Sometimes difficulties are coming from outside but we were happy to assist.
The Puncak remains a very special accommodation and yes difficult to put the atmosphere and special vibes exactly like they are on a photo.
We are very private hosts and will always trying to combine quality - effectiveness - awareness and enthusiasm.
Senggigi is a great strategic place for staying in Lombok. You can easy reach the North (Rinjani) - the beautiful West Coast line - the out of common South Lombok beaches and easy reach neighboring islands Bali or Nusa Penida by speedboat shuttle.
In four words : Welcome to The Puncak ;-)

Don't hesitate to contact us directly for any new request.

All the best,
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We had the most amazing time at the Puncak!!  I could not recommend it more.  A huge thank you to Jean-Paul and Nury for making our stay so wonderful, their hospitality, enthusiasm and overall help made our 7 days even better.

Before I write anything, it is important to note that the Puncak is in a remote part of Lombok and the fact they have created such a luxurious place to stay with limited resources is unbelievable.

The room and facilities are of such high quality, this flows right through from one of the comfiest beds I have ever slept in right through to the breakfast to die for every morning.

The view is breathtaking, and to wake up to it every morning was really special.  The infinity pool is also amazing and we use the room and facilities as much as we explored Lombok.

If you are looking for something exclusive, relaxed, luxury, warm, welcoming and completely stunning - look no further!
title: Stunning hilltop luxury retreat!

text:
Me and husband were very satisfied with the personal service from Nury and Jean Paul.
Nury personally cooked our breakfast and dinner. The ambience and view there were very relaxing and romantic. Thank you for the warm hospitality, Nury and Jean Paul :)
title: Romantic gateway

text:
We stayed in The Puncak with my family for four nights.
The Puncak was one of the hotels we booked during our travelling across Indonesia. 
Back home in Belgium we surely like to promote this place as the best of our entire trip.
This hilltop hotel is surrounded by amazing nature. The view from the rooms and the individual terraces is spectacular. The breakfast is better and more complete than you can imagine . Very nicely served with a wonderful pallet of colours, fruits and juices.
The hotel is very quiet and peaceful . The rooms are big and very clean. All around the service is just perfect.
Well done to Jean-Paul and Nury . We hade a great time in this first class space. 
 Family Huysentruyt Belgium
title: First class in Lombok

text:
Beautiful view, friendly, thoughtful staff and an extremely generous breakfast. We had a wonderful time. The butler (sorry we don't know how to spell your name !) was fantastic and very funny. Jean-Paul was kind and welcoming, and had a great amount of knowledge and recommendations for Lombok.

Room: large, with views over the pool and bay no matter which room you have. Great AC and fan, convenient amenities included (eg Anti malarials) in case you forgot to buy some. 

Location: magnificent view on the summit, this just requires a $2 taxi into town if you want a meal in Senggigi.

Food: we ordered some dinner one night and it was all delicious, fresh and served right on our terrace :) 

TIP: if arriving around lunchtime, don't bother buying lunch beforehand (like we did), we had a beautiful pasta and coconut water as a welcome, which we tried to fit in on top of an already full stomach!
title: Fantastic stay

text:
It was a last minute family holiday plan & I was searching around for 5star hotel chains around Senggigi area in Lombok when I discovered The Puncak. Somehow the online portals did not show availability for the dates i wished for & thus I contacted the owner, Jean Paul, directly. 

The rest, as they say, is history. 

As one arrives & walks up to the villa, the view of fantastic infinity pool with the ocean & mountain (all the way from Bali) as backdrop will make you gasp with wonder. The rooms are very comfortable with welcoming fragrant flower petals on the bed, thoughtful design & eco-friendly features. Breakfast provided was fresh & delicious. The staff at the villa are ever helpful & polite -- they even helped to make James Bond-style arrangements for my limited snorkeling time in the morning via speed boat to the Gili islands. The snorkel was incredible, with azure waters, myriad of colorful fishes & I even saw a green turtle! 

All in all, the warm hospitality & personal touches at The Puncak makes it a perfect haven for adults to rejuvenate & couples on honeymoon.
title: Fantastic villa stay over 5 star hotel chains

text: the view is spectacular, the rooms spacious, great hosts.Food is available on request and can be european or indonesian style. Breakfast was included and very copious. TV service in the room with great speed wi-fi in and outside the room. Dining room with fantastic view.
title: Great stay1

text:
A MUST STAY!!! I have travelled to over 20 countries and this is one of my favourite boutique hotels. My husband and I are a young couple from Canada who stayed at the Puncak on our honeymoon after diving in the Gili islands. Every part of our stay was amazing and it was worth every dollar. After a long drive tired and hot we arrived to a tasty drink and wonderful homemade pasta which we thoroughly enjoyed. The room was lovely and the pool and view was just stunning. Jean-Paul was a wonderful host, the hospitality was second to none. 
I highly recommend staying here as part of your trip to Lombok. 

Lauren & Dave
title: Absolutely Perfect!!!!

text:
We stayed here after travelling around Asia for 5 weeks. We were overwhelmed with the superb service and the amazing choice for breakfast!
The views over Sengiggi and looking out over Bali's mountain are incredible. The rooms were beauiful and the pools were refreshing.
The hotel is in an ideal location, we hired a moped for the 4 nights we stayed here and travelled from the north to the south of the island on the good roads. 
We have already spread the word to other travellers we have met- this is a must stay hotel!
title: Amazing views

text:
The view from the Puncak is breathtaking. Looking out across the ocean with the jungle covered hill below (and if the sky is clear) across to Bali is a really special experience.

This is a really special place, ideal if you are looking for an intimate, secluded get away (I also think it would be an awesome spot for a group yoga retreat). It is a peaceful, picturesque location and we couldn't have asked for a better first stop on our holiday to wonderful Lombok.

Jean-Paul, Nury and all their staff went out of their way to look after us and were incredibly helpful with recommendations for places to eat and activities to do in the area. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
title: Idyllic escape

text: From the unique and personal welcome from the owner, Jean Paul and his staff to the beautiful well maintained pool and bedrooms, the exceptional view and yummy delicious breakfast, what's not to love! There are only 5 bedrooms at Puncak, there's not bar as such but the mini bar is well stocked and if you want anything else, like a bottle of wine, the staff are more than happy to pop out and get it for you.  We even dined in one night and had a three course meal cooked by Jean Paul's wife and joint owner Nury, which was delicious.  The Puncak is about 10 min from Senggigi in a taxi which are easy to come by and inexpensive, one of the team will call one for you when needed. You can't really walk anywhere from the villa, it's up a pretty steep hill surrounded by other privately owned villas only.  It really does depends what you are looking for from a break away, the Puncak feels exclusive we wouldn't think twice about going back.
title: Perfect little escape, unique hospitality

text: Me and my wife spent a week of our honeymoon at The Puncak and we could not have chosen a better place. The view is absolutely magical. The rooms are spacious, the bed is very comfortable (I have back problems and find it hard to sleep in a lot of places and had no issues with this). The fact that ALL the food is homemade and fresh (they go to the market every morning so you have to ask in advance) makes a huge difference. Having a butler serving your every need feels luxurious and the fact that it is a group of only five villas gives you a feeling of privacy that is very nice. But what really makes The Puncak so special is the very familiar vibe it has. The owner personally welcomed us and showed us around and did everything in his power to fulfil our every desire. Thank you Jean Paul for everything! We'll be back soon!
title: Best honeymoon hotel in Lombok

text:
It was the end of Ramadan and all restaurants in Gili Air were closed for lunch, so we couldn't get anything to eat before going over to Bangsal Harbour and then on to the Puncak. The Puncak had arranged a pick-up from Bangsal at a very reasonable cost. To our surprise, we were served a free lunch upon arrival. Who does that? That's about as rare as it gets. We loved everything about the Puncak. The views are stunningly beautiful, best enjoyed with a glass of wine or a cocktail at sunset. The infinity pools are gorgeous too. The rooms are beautifully designed and the bed is as comfortable as the ones in a Ritz-Carlton. Breakfast was a total winner, the best we had on out two week trip though Bali, Lombok and the Gilis. Jean-Paul and Nury are splendid hosts and their staff is just adorable. A taxi ride to/from Senggigi takes just a few minutes and doesn't cost more than USD 2. Scooters can be rented in Senggigi for around USD 8/day.
The waters around Senggigi aren't very clean. For better beaches with blue water, head north along the coast. There are a few pretty beaches on the way to Bangsal Harbour, just 30 min away from Senggigi by scooter. They are almost deserted during the week but can get quite busy with locals on weekends and public holidays.
title: This must be one of the best hotels in Lombok

text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night after a long hike. It was exactly what we needed for a day of recovery. They really go above and beyond, with a welcome lunch (and that was full meal not just a snack!), sunset drinks and the best breakfast that we had during our three week Indonesian haunt.  The staff were very friendly, attentive and helpful. The view was stunning and the pool was on our doorstep. We also had dinner there and they have a knack for making amazing sauces. Highly recommend the puncak.
title: Perfect recovery after a long hike

text:
I first encountered the PUNCAK 3 years ago but ultimately travel plans changed.. But kept it in mind on my return and so glad I did. 
This place is beautiful, there is so much attention to detail that you wouldn't find anywhere else. 
It is not a luxury resort, but a cosy and intimate getaway with a personal touch. 
If you want anything, your hosts can arrange it for you, or they can leave you alone to enjoy the wonderful views. 

If you normally travel with a lower budget I would urge you to make an exception for this place as I did, it really is worth every penny!
title: Unbeatable, just book it

text:
We stayed here for 5 days and is very impressive at this place! Scenery is beautiful , peaceful and lots of privacy .. Owner of hotel - JP n Nuri are very friendly and attentive including their staffs.. One of their staff name Arya really needs to compliments as he really good and helpful..
We came here for our honeymoon and is really very memorable ...
Will not forget this place that brought us such a sweet sweet memories!! Thumb up!
title: Best for honey couple

text:
Great place - great stay!
Building: 5 stars (very modern, stylish)
Food: 4,5 stars (almost 5 stars)
Pool: 5 stars (ideal for relaxation)
Room: 4,5 stars (cozy)
Location: 4,5 stars (need a cab, but they are very easy to get)
Hospitality: 6 stars (super! thanks to JP & his lovely wife)
View: 7 stars (best sunset ever)
Will be back for sure.
Advised for leisure, relaxation, honeymoon,...
title: Best hospitality

text: We stayed as a couple in August 2015 - had an incredible time!  The views are stunning and it is so relaxing.  Food cooked by Nury is amazing and breakfast is huge!  The infinity pool is gorgeous and so peaceful but just a short ride into town.  We were very well looked after by Jean Paul and Nury who were so helpful and gave us good tips for restaurants and about our onwards travel.  Just sorry it has taken so long to write this review - would highly recommend!
title: Ended up staying longer as couldn't tear ourselves away!

text:
A great short stay. 
Nury & Jean Paul have thought of everything and will make sure you have an unforgetable stay.

A beautiful paradise where you will definetly want to come back to. Fabulous view, great food and friendly staff.

We came here for a few days to relax and privacy. Everything you need is available and if there is anything you need, you only need to ask.

Nury and Jean Paul have made these days memorable!!
title: Memorable, must experience!

text:
I stayed for 4 nights at the end of my trip to Bali and Lombok and the Puncak was the place I relaxed most and was made to feel most comfortable. Jean-Paul and Nury are exceptionally welcoming, as are the lovely, very friendly and discreet staff. Erna is an absolute star! 

Without doubt The Puncak is the perfect retreat above the hubbub of Sengiggi. It has two gorgeous infinity pools and the rooms (only 6 or 7 in total) are exquisitely appointed and very comfortable. Breakfast is served on your own terrace with great views towards the Gili Islands.

Nury is a superb cook and can create gorgeous suppers and if you like spicy, she will be delighted to accommodate you.

I cannot recommend the Puncak enough. It was the icing on the cake of my trip to Lombok and it is ideal for a couple's break and perfect for solos looking for a calm oasis.
title: Fantastic haven in the hills above Sengiggi

text: One night at the Puncak felt like a 100-day relaxation treatment. From the first moment we arrived until even after we left the Puncak, the owners and their staff took excellent care of us. The Puncak is luxurious, yet the room, meals, drinks and terrace are filled with sweet personal touches. One quickly feels at home at the Puncak. We enjoyed everything the Puncak had to offer: from the beautiful pajamas to the sunset drink and the chess game available on our private terrace. We regret our travelplans only allowed for one night here. Many thanks to Jean-Paul, Nury and their staff!!
title: Sweet personal touches

text:
We stayed here in September this year and had the most incredible 4 night stay. We stayed in a couple of other places on Lombok but this place was our favourite.

We were very lucky as we were the only guests staying throughout our entire stay so felt like we were in a fully serviced villa, which was incredible - but regardless there were a number of other bonuses:

Pros:
- The nicest and kindest hotel owners we've ever come across. Literally couldn't do enough to ensure you had a fabulous time
- By far and away the best food we'd had on Lombok. The owners cooked the food themselves and we were blown away - from traditional local food to a few European classics that were better than home (we're from London)
- Free sunset cocktails and snacks daily! When we arrived they also had prepared a full lunch and fresh coconut juice free of charge as they thought we might be hungry after a three hour drive...so thoughtful!
- Incredible views from the room overlooking stunning sunsets every night
- Really peaceful and quite. Every night lanterns were lit and placed all around the grounds - incredibly romantic
- Free bottled water and the fridge was stocked with great snacks

Cons:
The pillows were a bit generously stuffed for our personal preference..but literally that was it!

Thank you again both for such a wonderful stay! Antonia & Jordan x
title: Best hotel in Lombok - hands down

text:
We stayed here for 3 nights in the green room. It is an isolated property on a hill overlooking Senggigi Bay. There are 5 rooms - all decorated with taste and with a large front window so that you can see the sea from your bed. A shared infinity pool is just a metre away from your room. The employees are very nice and attentive. We received a welcome lunch upon arrival and sunset drinks every night. Nury-one of the owners-will cook you a tasty dinner you can have at the front of your room.
In the evening candles are lit all over the property which makes it very romantic.
The Puncak is on top of the hill and is perfect to relax away from any tourist masses and tourist shops and punters. You have to call a taxi (20.000 rupiah, 10 minutes) to go down to Senggigi for the beach or to eat in town. Walking down is not really an option.
Jean-Paul and Nury were very accomodating and helpful in organizing our transfer to Gili Air.
title: Quiet retreat overlooking Senggigi

text:
This is definitely the nicest property we've stayed at, beautiful and serene, surrounded by green hills and ocean views.
We've stayed a few nights at high end beach boutique hotels in Lombok, it wasn't as upscale as The Puncak, and the rates here are lower.
The place is absolute chill, Puncak and staff seem to have though ahead of time about what you need and the nice touches around everywhere.
They put luxury through truly outstanding personalized service.
The rooms are spacious and comfortable, the bed and linens top rate, spotless and kept brilliantly clean and tidy.
The breakfast was impossibly rich and full of variation.
Something precious I wouldn't consider to gamble about is my dinner. In Puncak you order it a few hours in advance. I love it. We always got briefed about what's fresh in the kitchen, or lively fresh ingredients were purchased right after putting our order. Brilliant.
Puncak offered us very creative cocktails with a smell, taste and visual experience which left an ever lasting impression on our pallet.
Well balanced organic salads and lettuce with intense subtly flavors of diverse fresh herbs, nuts, fruits and vinaigrette.
And finally our dinners were made with amazing creativity, harmonious, an ultimate dining experience. All this with the freshest ingredients and cooked to perfection.
The Puncak is worth every penny and highly recommended!
title: WORTH EVERY PENNY!

text:
This little boutique Puncak hotel deserves highest score from us.  The owner and staffs were the great host to our short break from Jakarta.  We travel around the world and this is a place where we would highly recommend.  

The room is in excellent condition and very clean.  Breakfast was great and in generous portion.  To us, it seems like everything is homemade here.  Staff are kind and helpful.  Jean-Paul and Nury were always there for us when we need their help.  Honestly, it was like home away from home.  We recommend you to try Nury's chicken curry, it is one of the best curry in Indonesia so far for us.  We still think a lot about it after that lovely dinner.  It was not necessary to leave the hotel for the sunset because the best sunset view is right in front of your room.  It was so beautiful.

Thanks for your hospitality and attention to details.  We had great holiday and we definitely be back.

From our overall experience, we believe this little hidden gems absolutely deserves fair rating and we personally found that the previous "Terrible" rating in this tripadvisor review to this hotel was not fair to them or maybe an unreal experience.
title: An incredible hotel/Hidden gems in Lombok.   Highly recommend.

photos.caption: A surprised welcome snack with large coconut juice!

text:
Really nice place to stay in. 
Amazing view and the place is quiet. 
The owners are incredibly nice and welcoming. It actually feels like home when you are there，and the owners put lot of effort for the guests to have everything they (might) want.
Everything is clean and well decorated and I personally loved the "candles atmosphere" you can create in your room.

Breakfast was just perfect, especially for bread lovers like us! And we really enjoy the fresh orange juice.

We were offered welcome cocktails and sunset cocktails as well, really nice attention!

It was a really pleasant stay and we would definitely go back.

A special thank you to the owners for the warm welcome!

Marion&Alex
title: Lovely place，adorable owners & staff!

text: We were only meant to stay 2 nights ended up staying another one and changing other plans ! Staff were amazing! Perfect place for a romantic getaway! Amazing views! The rooms were so clean and perfect. worth the money! Breakfast was also really good. Definitely the Highlight of our trip in Indonesia
title: Incredible

text: We only had one night there at Puncak, but want more!! It is the perfect place to relax with outstanding views over Senggigi, especially lazing in the infinity pool outside your room. Everything is perfect with incredible attention to detail. It is small, so you get individual attention from Jean Paul and Nury and their staff. They make you feel very special.   Drinks and food are great, and the rooms very comfortable and artfully decorated. We definitely want to come back!
title: Perfect place to relax

text: We stayed four nights at the Puncak. This place is amazing, everything is perfect their attention to detail in every aspect of the place is 10/10. The rooms which overlook the pool which overlook the sea are lovely, spotlessly clean with every amenity you could possibly need. Breakfast was a feast for your eyes and stomach. Everything was so perfectly laid out on the table each morning. This is a small boutique place to stay which offers peace and tranquility. The town is a short distance away about $2.00 in a taxi. Everyone was so friendly from the delightful owners to everyone we interacted with from taxi drivers to restaurant staff. I would definitely recommend this place to stay for couples, we will be back. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
title: Gorgeous place to stay

text: If you look for a piece of heaven and lots of tranquility, this is it! A superb ocean view with your own little verandah and the infinity pool just in front. A very rich breakfast and magnificent dinners are served on the verandah just in front of your room. You need to place the order in advance, as they make it mostly from "fresh". A special touch is the sunset drink you get around 5 PM, always perfectly timed. Nury and Jean-Paul runs a very intimate and friendly place that really makes you feel like at home. All the staff are really great and chit chat with you while giving excellent service. Blue bird taxis are called for when you feel to go out and they are a very good taxi company that drives safely and at very reasonable rates. Enjoy!!
title: Absolutely fantastic

text:
If only Jean-Paul and Nuri would adopt me I could live at The Puncak for the rest of my life! Everything was perfect, from the location (on top of the hill) to the services included in the price of the room (yummy and generous breakfast and cute sunset cocktail), from the staff (always friendly, polite and efficient) to the quality of the facilities (infinity pool, clean and modern room with sea view). It is clear that the owners want the guests to feel special and 100% satisfied with their stay. Mission accomplished: we loved every minute spent at The Puncak and would definitely recommend this little gem to our friends visiting Lombok.

PS: You will definitely need a mean of transportation if you plan to explore the beaches or have dinner in Senggigi area. We rented a scooter downtown in a shop called "Pitstop" because we wanted to be more independent but you could also easily take a taxi. It will cost you around 20,000 from the hotel to central Senggigi.
title: La crème de la crème

text: Located at the summit of the hill behind Sengiggi, this boutique hotel overlooks the ocean of Sengiggi. Indulgent, relaxing, serene, luxurious and intimate  are all words to describe The Puncak. What makes it even more special are the owners Jean-Paul and his wife Nuri. Meals are cooked for dinner and breakfast by Nuri and was some of the best food I've tasted. Mouthwatering flavoursome food and great service. I highly recommend the tom yum and spring rolls. The owners have thought about everything in this hotel, the attention to detail is perfect. The Puncak is soothing on the soul and definitely worth a visit.
title: Don't holiday in Bali, go to The Puncak

text: On our holiday in Lombok we stayed in the Puncak. We are used to travel in Europe, manely France, but with the luxury and service that you receive here in the Puncak it would not be payable in Europe. Jean-Paul and Nury, the owners, really succeed to give you the best time of your live. The best thing is to try it yourself!!
title: Incredible

text:
I stayed with my partner at The Puncak for 3 nights and we both wish we had booked our entire stay here. We came across this little gem on tripadvisor after changing our flights to come over 3 days earlier and we took a chance and booked The Puncak and it was the best gamble ever. The place is perfect for relaxation and you can't beat the view from your room where you can literally watch the sunset and sunrise from your bed (picture attached). You also have your own semi-private infinity pool which overlooks the beach from the mountain. 

What also makes this place is the guys who run it. Jean-Paul and Nury are amazing hosts who are both very genuine and really have a lot of heart when it comes to running this place.  Nury is cooks the food and we ordered the Tom Yum soup on our first night and it was absolutely brilliant! I've had Tom Yum all over the planet and this was probably the best I've had to date. We were planning on going out ever night to eat but spent most of time eating here because of the quality of the food. It beat anything down on the main strip of Senggigi. The complimentary breakfasts you get here is the equivalent to eating at a buffet. The selection of food they give you is amazing. 

I have to also rave about the the massage we had here. Nury has organised for a masseuse named Anna to come and massage myself and my partner and rather than one of those cheap, $6 clappy useless massages you get, Anna is well trained in massage and gave me the best massage I've had in Indonesia. She is more expensive at $25 but worth it as she actually knows what she is doing as opposed to rubbing your skin in the same spot over and over again.  I had a knot in my neck and she actually identified it and massaged it out completely.

Overall if I ever come back to Lombok I won't be staying anywhere else but this place. It's also the little things like the bathroom is packed with betadine, mosquito repellant, eye drops and outside your room you have chess, cards.. they've thought of everything. 

If I could give it 10 stars I would!
title: Literally the best place to stay in Lombok

text:
We stayed in the Puncak for four nights of our honeymoon and it has been the best place we stayed at.
The villa is located beautifully in the hills above Senggigi with stunning views of the sunset.
The rooms could be from an interior design magazine, carefully decorated and furnished to meet any visitor's need. The infinity pool is a very nice thing to enjoy also :)
The best thing, however is how Jean-Paul treats his guests, you always feel welcome, he listens, it feels like visiting friends! Nuri is a fabulous chef - we had the most amazing food - I highly recommend to try the ayam taliwang and the fish curry, delicious!!!
Staff is so polite, helpful and always available, yet always without being obtruisve.
We loved it and it has been a wonderful oasis to hide in!
title: A place to blow your mind

text: Amzing view and amazing services, on the top of a hill overlooking the sea and the Senggigi area, away from the bustling town, but only 5 minutes from all the good restaurant in Seengigi area. The owners Jean-Paul and Nury, are so so nice - excellent breakfast  - you feel like at home.
title: 1,000,000 $ view

text: This is a high quality place to stay and it is in a lovely peaceful location with fantastic views over the sea to Bali and also great views of the sunset. The rooms are spacious and very well equipped and , with floor to ceiling glass patio doors,you can even enjoy that fabulous view from bed. Breakfasts were lovely, especially the home-made pastries. Jean-Paul and all the staff were very attentive. Whilst all the local taxi drivers seem to know The Puncak, it  feels like a long drive back up the hill after a day/evening out, but in our view, well worth it for the location. My only criticism would be that the infinity pool in front of the rooms is not really big enough for swimming.
title: Peace and Tranquility

text:
We booked this hotel for 3 nights last year in order to rest a bit after a trek up to Rinjani volcano. 
It was an amazing experience : the view is phenomenal, the rooms are large and decorated with taste. The breakfast is delicious and the staff always ready to help. 
The hotel is outside of the town and you will need to take a cab to go to a restaurant is you do not want to have dinner at the hotel, but the price of the ride is very cheap. 
The only thing that bothered me a little was the open bathroom (you can't go to the toilet at night without waking up the person sleeping next to you...)
title: An amazing experience

text:
We spent three wonderful days at The Puncak earlier this month. Perched up on the hills above Senggigi, it has stunning views (particularly at sunset). The rooms are large and luxurious, with lovely bedding and lots of little 'extras' to make your stay smooth such as medicines, insect repellant, an adaptor... Breakfasts on the patio are wonderful...and very filling!

The staff here are also wonderful. Very attentive, friendly and proactive. We experienced a couple of hiccups during our stay, including a power cut, but the team there exceeded our expectations in how they dealt with it, and made sure we were comfortable. We wished that we could have stayed longer.

Before our stay we noticed that some reviewers had commented on the need to pay for wifi, and the quality of bottled water in the rooms. It seems that these feedbacks have been acted on as we had free wifi during our stay, and branded bottle water in the room. 

One thing that surprised us was how underdeveloped Senggigi is when it comes to restaurants and service. There are plenty of restaurants, but the quality of food is really variable, so choose where to have dinner carefully! We really liked The Square, and hopefully more restaurants in the area will follow their lead soon. The Puncak was the only place we visited on Lombok that seems to have mastered the concept of consistently great service. We loved it and would definitely like to go back!
title: Wonderful

text: My partner and I stayed for 6 nights at The Puncak during July, 2014.  The Puncak is unquestionably the best hotel we have ever stayed in and truly does reach “a new standard of excellence”.  Owners Jean-Paul and Nuri have created something unique, combining the luxury and high standards of a top hotel, with the kindness and attention to detail of an intimate B&B.  Couples enjoy near total privacy to enjoy the hotel’s beautiful infinity pools and stunning views of Gunung Batur on Bali and the western beaches of Lombok.  The rooms are beautifully designed and equipped and hotel staff could not do any more to make your stay enjoyable.  Nuri’s cooking is absolutely delicious and once tasted it is hard to pass up.  It is only a very short taxi journey to the beachfront restaurants and bars of Senggigi.  Day trips to explore Lombok are easily arranged by the hotel.  We would especially recommend snorkelling around the Gili Islands.  It is easy to travel to the hotel by taxi from Lombok’s airport or arrive in style on an express boat from Bali with a much shorter taxi ride.  Thank you so much Jean-Paul and Nuri for creating such an oasis of calm and for giving us such an enjoyable holiday.
title: Perfect relaxation

photos.caption: Sunset view from the room towards Bali

text: Although Sengigi is not yet as busy as Bali, but finding the Puncak and staying there for 7days was worth it. The place is on top of the hill away from the noise of the main road. Staying at the Puncak was a Sanctuary with the modern conveniences :). My husband and I loved the rooms especially the personal touch the owner and the staff puts up upon your arrival. We love every minute of our stay there. Truly appreciate how the staff are accommodating and helpful whenever I ask what and where is the best traditional Lombok food to try.

food is super, views stunning. We loved it. The PUNCAK rocks!

Darren & Maria Markham?
title: perfect...

text:
Wow. We were speechless when we arrived at The Puncak and stepped foot onto the terrace level with the rooms and the infinity pools overlooking Senggigi and Gunung Agung on the island of Bali. The views are breathtaking. You really have stepped into a place of tranquillity when you have arrived at The Puncak. The photos you see here are impressive but I promise you it is 10x better in person!

The rooms are fabulous, generous in size and well equipped. The greeting letter and romantic flowers upon arriving were a great personal touch by Jean-Paul and Nury. The rooms have been orientated to make the most of the amazing views, from your bed you wake up to views over Senggigi which is very hard to beat.

We were unfortunately delayed by 1 week due to the Sangeang Api volcano eruption, Jean-Paul and Nury were only too happy to accommodate us a week later. As it turned out we had the absolute pleasure of staying at The Puncak by ourselves for 4 magical days of the 7 we stayed. It was like a private hotel, so peaceful and relaxing. Even when other guests arrived our experience still felt intimate and personal.

The staff are an absolute standout and special thanks goes to Gede, Erwin and Angela for making our stay memorable. Gede was only too happy to teach us some Indonesian terms during our stay and we enjoyed practising these each day with the staff. They are very attentive and friendly and made our stay very enjoyable. Jean-Paul and Nury were also very personable and we enjoyed many candid conversations during our stay.

The food we found to be fantastic. Nury is the headchef and has mastered the international menu. The serving sizes are very generous, you will not go hungry here. Breakfast is like having a buffet on your table per person.

All in all, we can confidentially say this is the most amazing hotel we have ever stayed in. From the location, layout, pools, views, staff and food; everything was just perfect. We highly recommend it and look forward to returning to The Puncak hotel again next year.

James & Jodie
title: As close to perfection as practically possible

text: Me and my husband are just packing to leave after a 4 night stay at the puncak. The only negative I have from our whole stay here is that we have to leave, we have fallen in love with this boutique establishment! The rooms are beautiful and chic without being ostentatious which I love... And spotlessly clean. The staff are so attentive polite and friendly and the views are spectacular. I had read reviews on here prior to coming and noted people said it was a way out from senggigi... Well that Is what makes this place so special. It costs a mere $2 to get to sengigi in a taxi which the hotel staff order or you can hire a moped like we did and get around easy! Located up on the hill is what makes this place so great, you are away from the hustle and bustle in a perfect tranquil spot to relax and unwind and the photos do not do the view justice at all it's simply breathtaking. But my favourite part of my stay was the attention to detail and personal touches. Every night the staff bring you a yummy mocktail just as the sun is setting and light lanterns and candles through the hotel, the breakfasts are amazing and include something for everyone and every day you will notice fresh fruit and new flowers on your table. We celebrated my husbands 30th while we were here and decided to eat at the hotel and the food was just amazing plus the owners jean-Paul and Nouri brought my husband a birthday cake. I feel like I have written an essay but it's because I could not recommend this place enough, love it!
title: Amazingly beautiful attention to detail, don't want to leave!

text:

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
My wife and I spent three nights at The Puncak (which, not surprisingly, means 'The Summit' in Bahasa). It is indeed located near the top of a steep hill overlooking the water—some taxi drivers seemed to need a little coaxing to take their vehicles all the way. 

The owners Jean-Paul and Nury built The Puncak as a labor of love, and just imagining all the work they put in is staggering. We ended up being the only guests during our stay, so the quiet location was made even more quiet. Upon arrival our bed frame was covered in dozens of fresh flowers from outside, and each morning we were served a sumptuous breakfast of eggs, yogurt, fruits, and more outside our room. The room itself was very spacious—but unfortunately that meant the AC unit struggled to cool the air, making the nights fairly warm. 

Location-wise you're about an hour from the airport, 10min from the restaurants of Senggigi, and 30min from Bangsal, where you can catch boats to the Gilis. Aside from relaxing in the infinity pool, there's not much to do here on the grounds. 

If you're looking for an affordable, secluded base for Lombok lounging, this is it!

text:
We stayed last month and we were lucky enough to have the place to ourselves as there were no other guests at that time. We had our choice of rooms by either of the 2 long lap pools and looking out over the ocean and Mt Agung (only saw it during sunset for some reason. Amazing sunsets, great views, room large enough for 2 of us with our suitcases. Plenty of great amenities but the highlight of this place is the breakfasts!! Unbelievable. You get to choose the night before what hot breakfast you want and the owners go to the market and get in fresh ingredients fr you You then get french pressed coffee, any juice, a yukult! toast, and your breakfast with a plate of fresh fruit plus pastries. It was too much food but fantastic.

The meals here were great, you just need to let JP and his wife know beforehand so they can prepare.
The owners and their staff went out of their way to help you and advise you on anything. They were so accommodating!! Relaxing, restful and peaceful. Very pretty place with great views but quiet. You can take a cheap taxi into town which is only 10 mins away. Or hire a moped to get around. The Puncak is more suited to couples or friends travelling together, Not really set up for kids but older kids would be fine.
A wonderful stay. Thanks JP.

title: Wonderful stay on August 13th

text:
The earthquake: 
We arrived two days after the main earthquake hit Lombok.  The Puncak had suffered no damage at all.  In Senggigi many of the well built structures are unscathed along with the wooden/bamboo houses in the kampongs.  Less well built buildings haven’t faired so well.  In Senggigi folk are going about their daily business.  Everyone has a tale to tell and it’s a privilege to listen to their experiences.  We have been heartedly welcomed by all.  

The Puncak: 
Jean-Paul and Nury are charming hosts.  From the moment of our arrival they have gone out of their way to ensure we have had a really wonderful holiday on Lombok.

All five rooms in this cosy, boutique hotel step out onto private patios and overlooking the Lombok Strait with views across an infinity pool to Bali.  They are perfectly positioned to watch the sun setting behind the archetypical triangle of the Mt Agung volcano on Bali. 

Our room was simply but exquisitely furnished.  Natural materials and textures providing a calm, tranquil atmosphere.  A carefully prepared and beautifully presented breakfast  is served on your private patio.  It is abundant, fresh, healthy and delicious with a choice of a continental or local menus.  

The whole property is superbly maintained and clean.

In the aftermarket of the earthquakes Jean-Paul has arranged SCUBA diving and cycling tours for us.  Free transport is provided by some restaurants in Senggigi for our evening meal and we have eaten in town most nights. 
In addition it is a short walk from the hotel into the Monkey Forest in the hills behind.

If you have booked or are thinking of booking to come to Lombok, come!  The earthquakes were centred up north.  The rest of the island needs its tourism.
title: Stunning views.  Outstanding hospitality

photos.caption: View from our patio of sun setting over Bali

text:
My second visit to Sengigi and I decided to give the Puncak a try. Rather than being a resort down on the beach it is up in the hills on a turn off just south of the main strip of beaches. 

The owner and his wife are extremely hopsitable and it is clear their aim is for guests to simply relax and enjoy themselves.

And relaxation is what the Puncak is all about. When you wake in the morning you go out of your room straight onto a little porch area with a table and 2 chairs. Their you look over a stunning view of the Lombok strait. You can see the southern half of the island, across to Nusa Penida and then further along you see Bali. If the weather is clear the view of Mt Agung is absolutely stunning. It is also very quiet, You really have the feeling of being up there in an eagle's nest.

Then a delicious and extremely generous breakfast is served while you keep lapping up that view. It is even more stunning at night time as the sun sets behind Bali. It can be very hot sitting there in the afternoon sun - but hey - that's why the pools are there and you can keep enjoying the view from there.

Remember this is not a resort with a swim up bar or activities. Rather it is a place which is very quiet and you are left pretty much to yourself to relax and settle down.

There's plenty of places to go in town including beautiful restaurants right on the beach. Ordering a blue bird cab is extremely easy, and a trip to whereever it is you want to go in Sengigi takes about 10 minutes at a cost of 3-4 USD 

This is NOT a place to go if you want to get smashed on cheap booze. It's all about the view, peace, quiet, reflection and relaxation
title: Very different to your run-of-the-mill Sengig resort

text:
We stayed at the Puncak for four nights.  Upon arrival we were greated by the owner Jean Paul and his staff.  The room was presented with flower pedals which looked amazing.

During our stay the staff were professional, customer service was outstanding.  We were also provided with options should we of we wanted to undertake day activities which was helpful.  The team arranged delivery and pick up of the scooter which was very helpful.

The view was great from the villa, the infinity lap pool was also great.  The room was functional.  Better lighting to the ensuite would be recommended.

On day one and day two we were woken up at 8am by the adjoining owner using the chainsaw to cut down the trees which was constant for 2 hours.  On day three this also occurred, but Jean Paul visited the adjoining owner immediately and requested they cease work due to the noise which was helpful.

The breakfast was great, arrived on time.

Being a high end villa we would of expected all pay tv channels to be available such as Fox Movies, Fox Sports, which wasn't the case.

The internet was not reliable which was extremely disappointing, it made it difficult for ourselves to book flights/ accommodation / day trips for the remaining trip.   We could also not undertake our final payment to the Puncak via bank transfer as Jean Paul advised the issue with the internet would not permit them reviewing their bank account.  This meant we were required to visit an ATM at Senggigi which we felt uncomfortable withdrawing a large amount of cash for safety reasons.  As the ATM's only permit to withdraw 1,500,000 IDR to be withdrawn in one transaction we were required to undertake a further two transactions.  Upon returning home we reviewed our bank statement and we were charged 400,000 IDR for the ATM transaction fees which all could of been avoided if the internet worked.

Due to the heat, we constantly found bugs in the room, would be ideal to have a repellent system in the room.
title: Honeymoon

owner_response.text:
Dear Madhatterdelights.
Dear Guests,

Thank you very much for your review and input.
We are glad that you had an overall great honeymoon with us in The Puncak.

As you could experience, we are situated in an extreme location near the top of a hill with outstanding views and atmosphere.
We could manage in this extreme location to have cold and warm water, electricity and internet but we have learned also that we could not consider all these basic facilities for granted.  It's a daily challenge.
The only internet connection provider we have,  has sometimes short time failures and however we have learned to continuously looking for accurate solutions, this is not always possible to fix directly.  Unfortunately during your stay these short interruptions happened and even still today from time to time like in the most places in this island.  It is part of our many concerns to bring all tech facilities into a tropical and out of common environment,

Booking a hotel in a great natural environment means sometimes needing to make some little compromises with our city habits.
But we are always creative thinking and looking for solutions to please our guests and we are apologizing sincerely for your internet experience, We are aware that this is an important issue but  note that ' force-majeure ' is still happening in Lombok :) 

Please provide us a copy of your bank statement with the charge of 400,000 IDR, we will refund you this amount.

In every room we have bug repellents, .a pharmacy with additional repellent lotion, you must have missed this facility we are keen
to provide in each room.  Being situated at more than 200 meter above sea level, we have rarely problems with mosquitoes or insects,

We are thanking you for the positive points you have mentioned as well  :-)

Happy life....

Kind regards,

Jean-Paul & Nury
The Puncak, Lombok.
