text:
Booking was done via email with the owner. He responded to my emails promptly and was more than helpful.

On arrival, was informed of the breakfast 'system' of booking a day in advance. There were five rooms, all facing the infinity pool and to a further extent, Mt Agung.

Beautiful setting, and food was delicious. Booking of taxis was done easily, and so were the snorkelling trips to the Gilis. Shout-outs to Jas who guided us during that trip and to the resto boys from Gili Trawangan, insanely delicious fried spicy red snapper.

Recommended. Trip was done late 2014, redoing this as i lost my old account.
title: Chic Accommodation With Great Service

text:
The Puncak was the definition of luxurious romanticism. In the Indonesian native language, The Puncak means "The Summit" as it is perched atop one of the largest hills in Lombok, which overlooks miles of the gorgeous Lombokian coastline. Upon arrival we were greeted by the hotel owner with a warm smile and a little background on how The Puncak came to be. Jean Paul and his wife Nury built The Puncak without any contractors and you could tell throughout the stay that these two truly poured their hearts into creating this marvelous boutique hotel.

Although The Puncak is small and designed for honeymooners, any traveler can soak in the beauty and serenity of this place. Each room is named after a different type of stone, as a magnificent stone headpiece lines the wall above and behind the bed. The rooms were unique and differ in small detail which displays the amount of passion and effort that go into designing The Puncak. Sweet aromas and flower pedals are found throughout the room, giving off a feeling of being in a tranquil home rather than a hotel. With five elegant rooms, The Puncak is able to deliver an amazing experience to each and every guest with a staff who can always assist you with anything you need. You can really find another level of peace and relaxation with perfect views of the sun setting behind the water from the comfort of lounge chairs, your own dining table or the stunning infinity pool.

We were welcomed with a complimentary traditional Lombok salad and freshly picked coconut juice, which was wonderful after our hot boat ride from Gili Meno. The dinner is completely specially prepared and daily fresh, so whatever you are feeling, kindly ask the staff and they will craft the perfect meal. Along with dinner is a graceful arrangement of lanterns and lights to set the mood for a picturesque night of fine dining. 

My absolute favorite part of my stay at Puncak was the bed. Jean Paul informed us that he took special care in choosing tempurpedic mattresses and high thread count sheets from abroad to have shipped over, as he accurately pointed out—the most important part of staying at any hotel is sleeping so why not make it the best experience possible. I kid you not I slept for almost 11 hours, not because I was overly tired, but simply because I felt like I was sleeping on a cloud specifically designed for me.

Overall, The Puncak was a wonderful welcoming experience into the island of Lombok. Jean Paul and Nury ultimately want their guests to be submerged in an experience that tingles each of the five human senses. I am very happy and confident in saying that these two, along with the help of their kind staff, have perfected the art of making a guest feel blissful while staying at The Puncak. If you would like a unique encounter at a boutique hotel designed to cater your every comfort, then The Puncak is highly recommended.
title: "A Unique and Passionately Crafted Boutique Experience"

text: We have recently had 5 nights stay, May 12-17 2016, and we can highly recommend the accommodation.  We were looking for a quiet break, to contemplate, to write, to relax and to watch the world pass by and that is what we got.  The Puncak is intimate and small with attentive service.  The location up high overlooking the coast and the Balinese Volcanoes on the horizon is spectacular and enhances that feeling of isolation.  To catch a taxi down to the busy streets of Senggigi was simple but if you are fit the walk up and down the hill gets your heart racing and once home the cool pool is a welcome relief.  On our third day my wife said let's go to the Gili islands, I said its after 3 and she said but we have only just finished breakfast, she then said let's go on Sunday then, I said today is Sunday!  This little scenario reminds me what a holiday is all about.  By the way we went to the Gilli island the next day and loved swimming with the Sea Turtles.
title: When breakfast finishes at 2 pm you know you are on holidays

text:
:) We were extremely impressed overall with the service and quality from The Puncak staffs. Special mention to Erna who attended to us in the best possible way. 

:) Lovely, friendly, heartwarming owners, wonderful couple Jean-Paul & Nury. 
It seems quite obvious that our comfort and enjoyment was their priority and they took personal effort to ensure of it. They personally welcomed us and this made us feel very much at home. Such feel-good vibes and positive energies from them, which we appreciate :)

:) We had the romantic candlelit dinner package which was an amazing experience in itself, enjoying food under the stars.. The owner, who is also the main chef, prepares fresh, delicious, tantalising dishes. We particularly loved the grilled Mahi-Mahi and the Spaghetti Carbonara. 

:) We appreciate their efforts towards being an eco-friendly establishment. They are extremely conscious of preserving the natural environment of Lombok. 

:) Their attention to details in regards to the overall deco and aesthetics is impressive.

:) Especially love their complimentary welcome meal upon arrival! And their 5pm Sunset complimentary mocktails & chips! 

:) Breakfast was generous and fulfilling. 
 
Splendid, magnificent views of ocean, skies, greenery. 

Awesome time spent in The Puncak!
title: Amazing, Romantic time at The Puncak! :D

text:
Situated and position for sunset, the room is beautifully furnished with consideration of 5 senses, the sight, hearing, smell, touch and taste.

Sight with beautiful sunset and a infinity pool
Hear of waterfall (man made) rhythm
Smell of room is nice with air freshener (balance air quality)
Touch of the bed is comfortable (Wonder what brand is it)
Taste of breakfast is superb! (Never had such breakfast in my life)

Most importantly, caring staffs to help you around. It is a good trip in Puncak, Lombok.
title: Relaxing Sunset Room
partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan hotel ini

text:
I have nothing bad or negative to say about this place. It is AWESOME!!

Even before we arrived, the way the owners replied to my email, I could tell that they have put in a lot of effort to make the Puncak perfect. If there was a stronger word than perfect, I would use it!

From the time we arrived, we experienced the best hospitality in my entire life (and I travel almost every month). The rooms were perfectly clean and extremely comfortable, there was even a handwritten note by the owner Jean-Paul himelf and his wife. The hotel is focused on being environmentally friendly and organic, which is really awesome especially in the food. BEST MEALS EVER, served right outside your room. You have to order in advanced though, because they put in a lot of effort and love into preparing each meal, so it takes time. The views from the rooms are simply breathtaking, as the entire compound only has 5 rooms, the pool is practically like a private pool. The staff are super attentive to your needs, although you hardly see them (its like magic, really). Jean-Paul even dropped by on our last night to check on us, which is really nice of him. This place is perfect for healing, to get away from city noise, and its really really relaxing, we wished we could have stayed longer.

This is by far the best getaway we've ever had, and definitely would never be our last stay in the Puncak. Kudos to the owners and the staff for creating, designing and building this heaven in Lombok, we appreciate ALL the details (from the marble on the wall, to the comfy bedsheets, to the fresh flowers in the room and at every meal, the FOOD which is THE BEST OMG, and the list goes onnnn hehehehe). Hope to see you again soon!
title: Perfection

photos.caption: The ingredients in the orgasmic Puncak tea. MUST-TRY!!
Pool is about 3 metres from the room. Haha..

text: If you want peace and tranquility, then the puncak is perfect. Ihe villas are designed really well, everything is clean and the view is incredible. However, the only problem is the food. We decided to stay in and enjoy the villa on the first evening. We were having a lovely evening, watching the sunset, surrounded by candles, a complimentary cocktail, nice staff but sadly the food was terrible. This was a shame because it meant we had to leave the villa every night to eat, which was not what we had planned. The owner has put a lot of effort into making little touches which makes it very romantic, for instance every evening you get a complimentary mocktail at sunset. However food is very important to us, which was why we were a little disappointed.
title: Beautiful place but unfortunately poor food

owner_response.text:
Dear M-M-M-H2013,

We are thanking you for your input.
Overall it seems you had a great experience in many facets of your stay in The Puncak.
We are noting and wondering about your remark concerning our food : poor and terrible.

This is a serious allegation and issue for us.  Majority of our guests having experienced a high quality kitchen with a personal touch and a special twist, combining local and international cuisine.

We are daily very close to all activities of The Puncak and especially in the kitchen as we are
staying ourselves in many occasions inside the kitchen operations.  Nury is very dedicated in research of quality and originality.   We are always keen to receive constructive feed backs but we are preferring to receive precised remarks (what, when) so we can find out how to improve or to adapt if necessary and being able to respond you in a way that we are all learning from it...

We are unable to give you any profitable response which is against our commitment of quality in service and communication.

Following your review we had a special meeting with our staff in order to find out any remark or incident.  No one could remember any complain.  Dishes are mostly coming back
empty to our kitchen.
As your consideration is very general, without any specification , we would be grateful to receive more information about your experience.

On the other hand, we are understanding that tastes and cuisines are not always suitable for
all of the world traveling guests , having different food cultures, different habits, conservative considerations etc... But so far we have been always on top of our guests'  expectations.

Kind regards,

Jean-Paul & Nury

text:
I have stayed with my partner three nights at The Puncak. This 5-room resort is a paradise in the hills. We have never felt more welcomed at a hotel/resort than at The Puncak. Everything you might need is already in your room and if you need anything else the staff will assist you to meet your needs. The service was one of the best I have ever experienced - always friendly, very polite and attentive but also try to reduce the presence of themselves.

We still miss the breakfast and the home-cooked meals. The chef does a very good job combining local and international cuisine. Every meal has a special twist.

The view is stunning. To wake up and have this view on Gunung Agung is amazing and an unique experience.

Be aware that it is a secluded resort up in the hills. There are no other restaurants or shops around and expect an approx. 30min walk downhill. But it is also the beauty of this place. There are no rooms or facilities for kids. I would rather recommend it for couples. 

We are planning to go back in the near future. It is hard to find those places that are truly relaxing. The Puncak is one of these places.

text:
We spent our last four nights in Lombok at The Puncak and it was perfect.  The rooms were nice, all with a view and there's only five rooms so it's super peaceful...no kids there. The staff are super sweet and helpful. They do some awesome food too, the breakfasts were ridiculous.  We always saved some for a snack later.  God knows who can put away that much food first thing in the morning.  The servings of their other dishes are also quite generous.  Try the fish curry.  Everything else we ate there was really good also.  A bit pricey, but it's to be expected.  The rooms were simple but with all the mod-cons.

The only con is that it's a bit out of the way. But the staff will call a taxi for you any time you want and it only costs about 25000 rupiah to go into Senggigi.

My only regret was I didn't pat any of the dogs! 

I would recommend The Puncak as the ultimate chill out place for those who just wants to hang out and do nothing, but look at amazing sunsets and lounge around in the pools.

text:
Just returned from 5 nights at the Puncak after doing the Rinjani hike.  Perfect place for R&R.  Jean Paul and the team were amazingly helpful from pointing us in the right direction to hire a scooter to get around the island (a must in our opinion) to also giving directions to the pharmacy for us to get antiseptic cream for badly bruised toes!  People had criticized the model of the hotel saying that it should position itself as a B&B and even said the breakfasts are too big but we thought everything was lovely and our evening meal on arriving was fantastic.  One thing I was also pleased to see is that WiFi is now free and worked very well.  If you want 2 mins to the beach then maybe Quincy but if you want an amazing base from which you can explore the (other better) beaches like Nippah and also head down to Senggigi by scooter or taxi for the evenings then we think the Puncak was perfect!  Simon and Trudy.
PS - forgot to mention, the bed was just about the most comfortable we have slept in - beautiful!

text: Just got back from a quick 2 night trip to Lombok, stayed at the Puncak and couldn’t have asked for anything more, the location and the views were out of this world, the photos really don’t do it justice. Jean-Paul and his staff were amazing, always there to offer advice and recommendations if required, but definitely not over the top and in your face.  The breakfast was fantastic, served to the table outside your room, the most scenic breakfasts I have ever eaten.  The attention to detail, the lanterns at night, the power adapters, mosi repellents, small first aid items which luckily weren’t required all added to the perfectness of this hotel. It is not a private villa and is not promoted as such, there are only 5 rooms which were not all occupied during our stay, we did not feel that we lacked privacy as mentioned in some reviews. The fact that there are only 5 rooms allowed for a personal service from Jean-Paul and his team which you just don’t receive in the larger resorts. I would take a stay at the Puncak over a private villa in one of the larger resorts any time, I wouldn’t change a thing about the hotel and would definitely recommend the Puncak as the first choice for anyone visiting Lombok. Thank you Jean-Paul and your team, top job!

text:
I should start this review by stating that this is a BEAUTIFUL property with 5 star service, food and ambience.  That being said, this is not a family resort.  This is not because the owners are not "kid friendly" (they have a wonderful daughter) but because this is a boutique hotel that caters to couples and honeymooners.
We arrived at The Puncak in the afternoon with our 2 children.  We had booked this hotel using Agoda and at the time of booking Agoda had made no mention of this being an adults only hotel.  Even though we brought our 2 children the owners welcomed us with open arms and even closed out the openings that they had for the following day to protect both my family’s privacy and to make sure that couples did not arrive for a honeymoon to find out 3 year old in their gorgeous infinity pool.  This service is really above and beyond what they had to do...many other hotels would have turned us away.  
We stayed for 2 wonderful nights and enjoyed the welcome drinks, food and desserts immensely.  The rooms are well appointment with a nice TV, a great sound system, and large comfy bed.  Breakfast has already been raved about here on Tripadvisor, but I think it is important to mention dinner as well.  Make sure you have at least 1 dinner here and order in advance.  This allows the owners time to get the very freshest ingredients and prepare a 5 star culinary adventure for you.  
Even though the food is wonderful, it is the view that really steals the show.  On clear days you can see the volcanoes on neighboring Bali and the beautiful beaches on Lombok while enjoying a dip in the infinity pool.  
The owner is also a  wealth of information on the surrounding town and pointed us to 2 different restaurants that we adored.
I want to thank The Puncak again for welcoming our family when they really did not need to and for providing us with a much needed weekend of relaxation.  The Puncak is the rare 5 star boutique hotel that has as much HEART as it has STYLE.
title: Wonderful Hospitality

owner_response.text:
Dear Nick H,
Dear valued guests,

Thank you for your great feedback.
You are right, because of the extreme location and the fact that we have mainly honeymoon couples, we have a policy of no accommodation for children (0-12).
Apparently Agoda did not point enough this policy according to your experience, however it is mentioned on our website and our Facebook pages.
We had no other guests the day of your arrival and yes we closed out the availability of other rooms to make your check in possible with your family.  Note this kind of service is only possible in our place. We are always trying to find creative and happy solutions.

But as we need to be consequent toward other guests and toward our policy we just underline this was an unexpected and exceptional case.

The goal of The Puncak is to provide guests privacy - intimacy & tranquility in a charming and stylish atmosphere with breathtaking views.
It is only by implementation of a policy that we can provide such a comfort and memorable experiences to our high valued guests.

As you wrote with heart and style we like to welcome discerning guests to The Puncak.

Kindest regards,
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: An enchanting place high up on the hill, the Puncak proved to be a great choice to spend a few days during our honeymoon in June. Jean-Paul has a great team of staff who work very hard to deliver a high quality service.  The food was superb and savouring the fullsome breakfast outside of our room each day was certainly one of the highights of our stay.  Lombok is a fast developing island and so there was quite a lot of construction noise around, but this didn't disturb us too much.  Senggigi itself doesn't have too much to offer but we really enjoyed a day trip exploring other parts of the island including Senaru and the nearby islands.  Thanks again for a great stay. Stuart & Claire
title: Living the high life

text:
We stayed here for 4 nights, our aim was to relax and rest. the Puncak was perfect, really comfortable beds, amazing views out over the sea towards Bali, perfect sunsets each night and the staff were really friendly and helpful. 
Breakfasts were great, a wide choice for all tastes, I asked for less the next day as I didn't like to waste food. 
As there are only 5 rooms it was very peaceful and quiet. We walked down the hill and into town a couple of times which was a great walk including a couple of nice beaches. (Takes about 45-50 mins) taxis were easy to get both directions and only cost 17k. (Less than a £1) 
The sun loungers are very comfortable, warning, you may fall fast asleep without realising it!
title: 5 days of peace and quiet

owner_response.text:
Dear Adairclay,

Thank you for your input concerning your experience with us in The Puncak.
Our staff and we are pleased to have your positive feedback.

For the people who are thinking that The Puncak is may be to much  away from beach or from
Senggigi, you are the witness in our answer : it is even possible to walk down the hill where we are situated and to catch more busy life around and in Senggigi with plenty of activities or restaurants. Many guests just love to walk around as from a hill you always enjoy the perspectives and views.

Kind regards,

Jean-Paul & Nury
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We booked three rooms (of the five) at The Puncak and were extremely pleased with the views, the facility, and the lovely owners. The rooms and the outlook are nicer than the pictures indicate - I think they are from before they opened and had added some finishing touches. We usually stay down in Senggigi in The Qunci Villas, but they were full when we planned our last minute trip. I was pleasantly surprised by the contrast. While Qunci is beachside and quite exclusive, the Puncak was a different league given they only have 5 rooms. 

Like at Qunci, you do need to take a cab to get to most places. It would be 5 - 10 minutes to most of the restaurants in Senggigi. (Square was our new favourite, this trip).  

This is a family run place where the owners have put their heart and soul into the place. It shows in their approach but also the thoughtful little things that larger places don't think of. The attention to detail is really sweet. 

It would be remiss not to mention the amazing breakfast. Each person is served a range of fruit, yoghurt, yukhult, cereal, flavoured and plain milk and plunger coffee. Then you also receive either European or Indonesian breakfast based on your choice. It's a huge amount of food and will set you up well for even the most strenuous day. 

One evening, two of our group stayed in and ate at the hotel. They raved about the food. 

The beds are really big and comfortable and like the rest of the room and place, impeccably clean. 

Just a note. Lombok is still developing and maturing as a destination. So don't expect the level of experience or smoothness you'd expect say in Australia or Europe. We live in Bali and even here there are reasonably regular problems when it comes to services like electricity or internet access. If being patient or understanding is not in your nature, you'd be better served going to a part of the world with more experience with (and potentially overrun by) tourists.
title: Amazing view and wonderful hosts

Kind regards,

Jean-Paul & Nury

text: The only negative I have regarding The Puncak is that we only stayed one night.  If you are after somewhere quiet to relax with views second to none, you can't go past this place.  We absolutely loved our stay.  We had been travelling Lombok and the Gili Islands and wanted somewhere to unwind and relax.  We certainly found it.  Credit to Jean-Paul and his wife for providing a luxurious service.  We would most definitely stay again.  Room was spotless.  Bed was fantastic.  All amenities in perfect working order.  Food was lovely and the produce so tasty and fresh.  Finally, did I mention the view!

text: Amazing view, very private and exclusive, perfect place to have your quiet little vacation in lombok, to the owner: if you have one of these hotels down in jakarta/bali id gladly come again and again:) love every bit of the time in this hotel!!
title: Amazing hotel!

text:
As soon as you get up the hill to take your room, you would face one of the most extraordinary natural views in your life. It's truly breathtaking. You would have your room and private pool adjusted to edge of hill slope to enjoy every bit of that view.
This hotel is small sized well-maintained one with just a few staff and other guests around you so you would completely have your privacy to rest and enjoy yourself for a few days. 
Breakfast is fine and fresh and it's always pleasant to take it at your balcony. 
This hotel is couples oriented and very romantic type regardless your age. Hence if you want sometime free of your busy life with your partner don't forget it.
As it's located up the hill, there is just one way to reach that and you always have to take a taxi to get around. The only thing hat I can mention as cons is that sometimes there is a kind of construction noise reflecting from the valley(maybe for one or two hour a day) which you can not avoid, and effects the very silent and peaceful rooms environment. Hope it's finished by now. 
The near beach side is fine and worth swimming and tanning. 
I've seen the most beautiful sunset and twilight here.
title: You are truly cast away from busy life!

text: We stayed two nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The view is magnificent! We came here after hiking the Rinjani and couldn't think of a better place to relax. The room (we stayed in red marble room) is beautiful and very comfortable. You can tell that lots of thought went into the details. We received a warm welcome at the reception and staff is friendly and helpful. The food was good too and the portions big enough. Worth mentioning too is the high standard of cleanliness. We live in Indonesia for several years now and it is very hard to find a place as clean and tidy as this one. It's refreshing to say the least. There are, in fact, many positive things to comment on. Therefore....close to perfection! We would definitely want to stay here again one day.
title: Close to perfection!

text:
My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights at the end of December 2012. We originally posted a review via my iPhone while in Lombok but for some reason its not listed on tripadvisor so I am writing another one as we have decided to come back to The Puncak in July.

Firstly let me state, the view is AMAZING. It doesnt get any better than this. The images do not do it justice, you have to see it to believe it!

Secondly, the service is FIRST CLASS. tThe service we received was personalised and we were made to feel at home. We didn't venture out during the day as we decided we needed to relax and get away from it all. We made full use of the facility from the beautiful pools, to the lunches and dinners. I like the fact that staff asked what time we would like lunch and what time for dinner and we had it served on our table just outside our rooms. The food is fantastic and Nuri being a chef and her well trained cooks is a testament to the quality of the food. In fact, in our conversations with Jean Paul, he and Nuri venture out daily to the markets to buy fresh produce - this is just fantastic service.

Thirdly, the rooms are superb, excellent appointments, fantastic decor and views of Bali from while lying on our bed. I believe we stayed in room #4.

Having the owners around was a great touch. We enjoyed our conversations with Jean Paul and Nuri and shared stories. This is something that made our trip even better as it made us feel more welcome.

To sum up, my wife and I are seasoned travellers, we travel every 4-5 months, and I personally have stayed in many countries in top resorts and hotels. The Puncak is a boutiwue establishment catering for a niche market which is what makes it superb and provides a pleasant contrast to larger resorts.

Well done Jean Paul & Nuri. you have won us over and we will be back many times.

Regards
R&L
title: AMAZING - FIRST CLASS SERVICE AND LOCATION

text:
We had  lately a few days in The Puncak and were really completely seduced by the charm of this boutique hotel.
We are disagreeing previous reviews : this place is stunning.  Yes quit small but amazing.  There are only
5 suites with panoramic infinity pools just in front of the rooms.  The owners/managers are very careful and
looking out that our comfort was on his best.  Nury is a very dedicated Chef . We decided to stay every night
for dinner because there was no other place we could having better and tasteful food as it was far our best experience
during our trip.  We had no electricity blackout, we were informed before check in about payment process,
we really enjoyed the pool, the views are amazing.  There were other guests but not 1 minute we were disturbed by
any lack of privacy.  Advising people not to book The Puncak is really weird it would be the same as presenting
a glass of a  Grand Cru Bordeaux wine to someone and asking not to drink it !   We had a wonderful time and advising our friends
and relations to go for it : The Puncak, Lombok , especially if you like on a hill, the place is not on the beach, however
the beach is close.  Practice also : the owners will always advice you the best options in terms of transport, day trip etc...
Just enjoy !
title: The Puncak :  Exclusive Boutique place on his best !

text: I have to agree with many of the reviews of these villas. The view is sensational, the staff very friendly and the pools lovely. However, I think the owners could do a little more to live up to the exclusive title they push. It would be great if they provided a transport service into town. I know this can become a big job for a small establishment. However, even if they offer a service into town 3 times a day that would be helpful. They could drop off in the morning, then drop off and pick up again at lunch time and then again at dinner time. My husband and I wanted to have a day at the villa rather than going into town, yet we could not get lunch, the air conditioning was turned off and we were left with no option other than going into town. I am sure even honeymoon couples would like to have a day where they could stay in the villa. When the power is turned off, the hot water goes with it and due to this I only had one warm shower in our 4 day stay. Even though the weather is warm, it is still nice to have warm rather than cold showers. Overall I think rather than telling everyone how exclusive the villas are perhaps the owners could provide additional services that make it exclusive such as transport, continued power, a small bar service, a limited lunch service and less rules of what you can and cannot do.
title: Good with some reservations

text:
Our stay here was one of contrasts.There are many positive aspects of this place including:

1.The extraordinary view, particularly at sunset, across to Mount Agung.

2.Consistent with many places in Indonesia, the high quality of the staff.

3. The wonderful, if not somewhat excessive, breakfast.

4. The lovely pools.

However, despite the many positive and gushing reviews, the place is not perfect. Negative aspects include:

1.The lack of privacy. The 5 rooms adjoin and you inevitably have fellow guests and staff pass your room. If there are other guests, you will share the pool, unlike other villas nearby eg The Imaj.

2.The policy/edict of not bringing food to the villas. Obviously there are many fine places in which to dine in town eg The Square, The Asmara and Warung Paradiso, but given that the restaurant in the villas is not open during the day, you really are compelled to dine out.

3. The apparent lack of a generator. As blackouts are daily occurrences, the lack of air con might cause discomfort. Many cheaper places have one, so why not here?

4.As the place is relatively expensive and claims to be exclusive, the tissues and toilet paper should be improved and the soap and shampoo replenished more regularly.

Without being seen to be too critical, the place is neither exclusive  nor are they villas. They represent a reasonable place to stay, but my experience is that there are better value options in the area.The owners have gone to considerable trouble to establish this place, for which they deserve praise, but the description of the place is, in my view, a misnomer.
title: Mixed experience

text:
The sign outside The Puncak says "Exclusive Villas" and its website refers to it as a "boutique hotel". I disagree. Its a B&B. Its quite a good B&B, but its a B&B nonetheless and it therefore has some limitations about which you should be clear before staying. If you don't like B&Bs, then don't stay here. And note this too: they don't take credit cards.

Firstly, the view is supreme, no doubt. Sitting outside your room, or in one of the two pools outside the rooms, with a Bintang in hand, watching the boats, the palm trees, the surf, the heat haze and the sunsets is just fantastic. Of course the trade-off for this is being at the top of a long, steep road and needing to get taxis in and out of town. The drive down the road is 5 minutes, then its about 10 mins to the centre of Sengiggi. We walked one day and it took over an hour (in blistering heat!). It is surprising that such an "exclusive" property in such an "extreme" location does not offer free transport into and out of town (or airport transfers).

The rooms are very basic in design, with unpolished timber floors, but comfortable and tastefully decorated. They are 5 concrete "boxes" next to each other, facing West with a the front wall all glass and a sliding door. Three rooms are separated from the other two by the kitchen/staff area. Each group of rooms have a plunge pool in front. There seems to be no restriction on which poll you use, but it is natural to use the one in front of your room.

One surprising thing for an "exclusive" property, the drinking water is provided in unmarked, unsealed bottles with plastic corks and paper wrapping with "The Puncak" printed on (as has every towel and even the toilet paper wrapping). These bottles are refilled daily from some mysterious source of potable water. The lighting, especially in the bathroom, is dim.

The aircon is barely up to the job of cooling the rooms and the toilet cubicle does not seem to get the benefit of the airconditioning at all, which makes it a sweat-box. As the villas get full sun all afternoon, the rooms can get very hot, even with the air con and fan going. Also, the aircon (in fact, all electricity) was turned off for a few hours in the middle of every day, which was very annoying and meant the cooling had to start from scratch in the hottest part of the day. The staff seemed to suggest this was a power supply problem beyond their control, but if so, why don't they have a generator? (it may have had something to do with the building site across the road, which pumped out loud music and hammering sounds all day). The afternoon sun can be absolutely scorching and the only way to get out of the sun in the afternoon is to retreat to your room and close the curtains, which takes the view out of play.

In the rooms there are no internal doors to the bathroom area, so noise is a factor - its very hard for one person to sleep while the other is using the bathroom or opening/closing the huge sliding door to go in/out of the room. I agree with comments in other reviews that there is not much privacy between rooms - you need to always have the curtains shut if you want privacy and, again, this takes the view out of play. Likewise, sitting outside your room by the pool, you are right next to your neighbours, with no privacy. Further, the staff seem to lurk around all day and walk past the rooms a lot, as the entrance to the kitchen/staff area is right between two of the rooms. 

The much vaunted breakfast is indeed huge, in fact probably a bit over-the-top and ordering anything specific was very haphazard. Even if you order something specific, you still get the full breakfast production as well, which is too much to eat. In a country with such poverty, wasting so much food seems wrong. It might be better to just take an order from the guests as to what they actually want and use the money saved on breakfast to provide free wi-fi instead. Also, I twice ordered the (cooked) Indonesian breakfast but it never came and when I tried to order some bacon (which my wife got with the eggs she ordered), they took hers and gave it to me!

Lunch was non-existent. I'll say that again. There was no lunch. I note the other reviews which claim that the kitchen was responsive to requests. Well not to us they weren't. The only option for lunch was to go into town. There is no room service menu and (at least when we were there) no lunch service. This was despite my enquiry on the first night about lunch the next day and being told "yes, you can order lunch one hour in advance" however when it came to lunch time next day I tried to order and was told "the kitchen opens at 4pm". Which of course means you have to get out of the pool, get dry, get dressed, order a taxi and head into town for lunch. Then you have to get back up there.

That was the key thing for me that makes The Puncak a B&B rather than a hotel. They obviously expect you to be out all day. There's no room service menu. You can't get a club sandwich (or anything else) when you want one and we were specifically told on check-in that it is not permitted to bring food into the rooms. Also, there's no bar area, just a mini bar in the room (items from which you are asked to sign for every day). They have no wine or spirits. They give you little cocktails at sunset, which is very nice, but when we asked for some more (which we were happy to pay for) the staff said they had to ask the owner and the response (by text message, apparently) was that they needed the orange juice for breakfast.

Adding to the B&B status, is the fact that the owners live upstairs with children and a dog. While we never heard any footsteps or noise, as noted in other reviews, they have no separate entrance and there was a lot of coming and going, including one afternoon when the owners had some friends over and they sat with them in the poolside area while we were swimming and relaxing - again, no privacy. You are in their home. It is a B&B.

But perhaps the least "exclusive" thing of all is that they don't take credit cards. None. Just cash. They said this was due to the "extreme" location. But surely, if you have Wi Fi and a phone then you can have a credit card machine. This situation meant we had to get an estimate of our bill on the last day and get a taxi into town to withdraw from the ATM sufficient cash to pay the bill. Also, they don't give receipts and had to be asked twice to sign/stamp the bill as having been paid.

Overall I think the Punchak is pretentious. It is not "exclusive", it just has its name embossed on all the towels and is quite difficult to get to. Its a decent B&B, but as I have never liked B&Bs, I will not stay at this one again, despite the view. I think a nice hotel on the beach is ultimately more relaxing and gives you more options. You can drive up in a taxi and see the view whenever you want.
title: Pretentious B&B

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
How would you like it to wake up to a wonderful view of infinity pool and sea beyond? In the morning you can go for a dip right at the doorstep of your room and watch the boats pass by. At about 6pm, you get a cool drink and watch the sunset. When night falls, you see the constellation of stars. And you can arrange for a massage in your hotel as well.

However, if you want to be next to the beach or in the centre of activity then look else where. The Puncak is on the top of a hill and thus you need to get a taxi to get down to town which is 10mins away.

Jean Paul and Nury are great hosts making sure your stay is a wonderful one. Yes, I would definitely recommend the Puncak if you want a place to chill.
title: If you are looking for peace, tranquility and a great view, this is the place.

owner_response.text:
Dear PiratePixels,

Thank you for sharing your sensations about your experience with us.

Yes, we are not situated near the beach but at the top of a hill where you can admire the ocean
with views to Bali, Nusa Penida and beautiful peninsula of Sekotong.

We are looking forward to see you back in Lombok.

Warm regards,

Jean-Paul & Nury
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
If you would like to be away from the main part of Senggigi and to enjoy a view from the hill-top, you will like this place. Room was clean, breakfast had a good volume, relaxing environment.
Kitchen was flexible to take our requests, hotel staffs helped us arranging day-trips and suggested dinner spots etc... thanks to them, we had a comfortable stay. Thank you!

Access to the accommodation can be: car (taxi/driver), motorbike or by foot (you need to be in a quite good condition if you want to walk all the way up - don't walk up the hill if you have luggages!)

Minor (-) points: 
I woke up several mornings by hearing foot step sounds from the ceiling... then I realised that owner's family actually live upstairs... and so it must have been someone walking just above our room.
Upon check-out there were some little issues: exchange rate for the payment, deposit fee charges and other small "number" related matters. Internet was extra charge. Maybe it is just the way how people run business in Lombok... but for those who are sensitive with little charges, you might feel uncomfortable.
title: Nice view and relaxing

owner_response.text:
Dear' Unknown' Guests, 

Thank you for your nice and relaxing input.
Yes, as the owners we like to walk,  to step and even to dance above (?) the rooms of our guests, especially every early morning so we are sure that with this early wake-up, guests will not missing the huge coming breakfast... :-)

Just for your information : neither the owners nor any other persons are living just above the rooms of the guests, but we will specially pay attention that these foot steps will not occur anymore and  disappear as fast as they came, however you are the first to mention. This happened somewhere in august 2012 ?

Little charges are better than heavy charges, as we are just charging what guests are ordering. Number-related matters are clearly mentioned and published. Exchange rates are issues changing day by day however we are keeping a client-friendly rate when it is about little and even lesser little charges.

Regards,

Jean-Paul & Nury
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
On top of a hill, built with love from its very accommodating owners Jean Paul & Nuri This place is a real treat! 

We spent 2 nights here over January after spending a week on the gilis we felt it would be ok not to be right on the beach. I dont think we could of chosen a better place! The views are spectacular, the pool is freshing and the sunsets are amazing.. even with abit of cloud cover they did not disappoint. It was simply stunning to watch with beer in hand. 

The rooms where lovely the bed was the comfiest i had slept on in Asia and the food was fresh and tasty most dishes seemed to be made by the owners wife which was nice to see, shes a great chef we loved all our dishes. And the breakfasts, my god what a breakfast! (see my picture that was for one person!) It was easy to leave the hill to have a look around taxis only coat a couple of dollars each way just make sure you take a business card with you with a phone number. 'The hill' seems to be a newer part of town not many taxis know what the punack is.  

All up this place was a great retreat for a couple of days and i cannot highly recommend enough!

*Do remember from writing this, cash only. I would just transfer the lot via paypal to avoid high atm fees*
title: Perfect, amazing, stunning!

text:
The Puncak on top of a hill invites you to enter by the large white stairs leading you to the minimalistic designed lobby. The whole place, builded and designed by the owners is a masterpiece with a great sense of detail and intelligent configuration.  The Puncak could keep great panorama and tranquility however a building fever in area making this hill much lesser attractive than expected.
The trained staff, the know how, the high quality of a la carte meals, the atmospherical breakfasts, the large possibility of day trip activities, the practical  advice in different matters, are making from a journey in The Puncak an unforgettable experience.
title: Magic The Puncak

owner_response.text:
