text: The Puncak is a great little hotel, tastefully decorated and with stunning sunsets.  The owners, Paul and Nuri, are fantastic hosts; Paul really helped us make the most of our time there, suggesting several excursions including the trips that we took to waterfalls and snorkeling on the Gilis, which were both fantastic.  Nuri is an amazing cook -- we didn't eat a single meal outside the hotel during the four days we were there because we didn't want to miss out!  And the rest of the staff is super helpful and gracious too.
title: Sunsets in Paradise

text:
We stayed at the Puncak after climbing Mt. Rinjani. The luxurious accommodations were a welcome respite. The hotel sits atop a huge hill and has a great view. The pools are great and the service was good as well. We loved the welcome drink and the multiple course breakfast.  

A few cons....there is not free Wifi and instead they charge $15 for access. While only five rooms, the layout is such that you see all other guests at all times. No strong feeling of seclusion. Town is also a cab ride instead of walking distance away.
title: Amazing views and great food!

owner_response.text:
Dear Guests,

Thank you for your appreciation.

The Puncak is situated in an extreme location on the top of a hill.

Extreme location means that issues like WiFi but also Water and Electricity  cannot be considered for granted. We have mainly total comfort in that matters because of a  proactive management. 

The Puncak is a small and charming place.  If you are looking for a strong feeling of seclusion we would advice you to rent a private Villa.
So far we are close to full booked for a large part of the year with meanly reports of excellence.
You can never totally avoid seeing other guests however our design is made for a complete as possible feeling of tranquility and intimacy.

However we have decided starting from now, to limit bookings and avoiding to be full booked.  Unfortunately we will need to refuse more demands of reservations as we have only 5 exclusive and comfortable rooms.

If you you are deciding to book The Puncak in a near future, please don't wait until the last days

A bon entendeur salut.

Kind regards,

Jean-Paul & Nury
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: My husband and I have spent 5 days in this wonderful boutique resort. The property is stunning, everything is new and well taken in care of, the view is just breathtaking. We have traveled a lot in Indonesia but this place is by far the nicest where we have been. What makes The Puncak a not-to-be-missed-place are the owners and the staff, all wonderful people from a professional and human point of view: they make you feel at home and completely spoiled at the same time. Compliments Jean-Paul and Nuri for the wonderful job and just go on like this. We will come back!
title: Completely spoiled!

text:
To Jean Paul, Nury and staff. Thank you immensely for your hospitality, sincerity and dedication. The four of us had a fantastic time; for 2 of our party it was their first time overseas and an unforgettable experience. We ourselves have travelled extensively and stayed in accommodation of all types from 6 stars to 3 stars. For us, The Puncak rates as one of our best of all time.
I feel the Puncak is a boutique and niche residence that offers seclusion and service that is difficult to match in other locations for the price of your stay. I feel that JP, Nury and the staff have created a discerning niche; while it may not appeal to some it will certainly appeal to the vast majority looking for that little extra something: special and personal.
The sunsets are brilliant. The ambience of sitting in an infinity pool with a cool drink in hand looking out over the ocean is fantastic. Waking up in the morning with a view at the top of the world is difficult to match. It is quiet, the staff are omnipresent while being unobtrusive- a rather difficult balance to achieve normally.
The food: we thought the breakfasts were the perfect match. A variety of hot, cold, savoury, local, international: a little of each all in the same spread. If you consumed all of what was presented each morning it was more than enough. We struggled to do so. Please note this is not a buffet; it is your own personalised and individualised breakfast on your own little terrace in front of your room. We ate in several times and thought the food was great, particular when you consider this is not a modern country or island. Do you need to order a few hours in advance- “yes”. They accommodate a maximum of 10 people and rely on fresh produce, so I understand the need to do so. 
It is always interesting to read others comments; however, any experience is extremely individual and interpretational. I noted discussion about JP and Nury’s daughter. We never found her to be noisy, then again we have children and expect and understand that they are energetic; all part of being a child. For example, on our first night in Lombok our luggage was lost in transit and did not arrive until 10pm at night (9 hours later).  JP and Nury spent 4 hours on constant phone calls tracking down our luggage to ensure it did arrive; we had failed to even make contact with the airline during the day. The last hour or so of this their daughter was asleep on the couch at reception as her parents were focused on assisting us while we enjoyed the hospitality. To us that is above and beyond, and we thank them immensely for assisting us while taking time out from their private life.
I also read about the dogs. It was explained to us when we arrived that they are there for the protection of us, which is fine with me. We never experienced them running around; in fact, when they were off the lead they were under control.
JP and Nury- we feel you have achieved what you set out to: a little piece of paradise in harmony with its location. If you would like to experience this please visit, if you are looking for a resort then it would probably pay to visit one.
title: an amazing and spectacular place!

text:
We haven't been to lombok before so we were quite unsure whether we picked the right place to stay for 2 nights. All and all, you get what you see in the picture. From the website itself the room looks clean and spacious. I've no complains and whatsoever staying in this beautiful hotel. I love for the fact that there's only 5 rooms in the puncak therefore it is very serene and peaceful. We enjoyed so much with the super cooling water in the infinity pool, the beautiful sunset and of course the breeze. The people in the hotel are very helpful and friendly. they are always there to help us whenever we needed. The room were cleaned nicely :) 

The only down part was the food. we tried the indonesian fried rice and noodle and also the tom yum soup. it looked great but it didnt taste as great as it looks. but overall, we loved our stay at the puncak and will never hesitate to go back again when we get the chance to go to lombok.
title: Just LOVE IT!

photos.caption: The exact view from my bed

text: This cosy boutique resort is truly a gem with most breathtaking views. The 4 nights we spent here passed by quickly. This is a perfect place for a gateway where you will have a relaxing time. The hotel is located on a hill and it's about 20 mins by taxi or motorbike to senggigi town. Ask the owners for tips on sight seeing. Overall great place to stay.
title: Heaven on earth

text:
We stayed here, our second last stop on our honeymoon and it was fantastic.
Breakfasts are unbelievable large, service is amazing and the rooms clean, large and very nice.
Jean-Paul was the perfect host and the staff are exactly what you would expect staying in any five-star setting.
title: The best view in Senggigi

text:
Friendly staff,good service with a uphill view over.
the room is well decorated,very clean and spacious.
we'll say this hotel is one of our best stay experience in Indonesia.
the location is a little far away from busy area with excellent view!!

Highly recommend this hotel!!
title: Romantic atsmosphere.

text:
I read the only 'Average' review of The Puncak and have to say that generally people need to check their own expectations of a hotel before booking it. We knew what we were going for when deciding to go for an exclusive accomodation in a comparatively remote setting versus a beachfront resort with many more rooms and staff and perhaps in a more convenient location. 

The Puncak is a place to relax and unwind and take everything slowly. We chose to stay here knowing that we would have spent the prior 3 days on Mt Rinjani and would just be happy to chill out in a comfortable and quiet place. The Puncak has the most stunning views and gives you the privacy and calm not many resorts can provide. Often you feel like the only people there. And even when you have other guests or staff walking around, it's not bustling or noisy. Everyone gets that you are there to spend some quiet time and will leave you to it unless you need anything.

The owners are very switched-on people who work very hard to keep things to a very high standard. They visit the market everyday to buy the best produce for the food and the lady owner herself does most (if not all?) the cooking. So the result is an amazing spread for breakfast, often leaving you full and satisfied right through to late afternoon plus good quality food if you order lunch or dinner. You need to understand that because of the limited staff (despite there being only 5 rooms), you do need to give enough notice if you would like a meal. But rest assured they will try to do it if you ask.  Staffing is a major issue in this part of the world so something needs to give in a small establishment. Saying that, the owners did an amazing job with staff training as everyone there is smiley, friendly and helpful. Indra demonstrated so much initiative in assisting with our needs.We kept asking for more complementary water as it was a really hot day and we were going through our jug very quickly many times. We were a little embarrassed about that but not for once did anyone make us feel that way and it was always a quick 'Yes of course!' with a smile.

The only slight complaint we had was the plumbing in the toilet. We noticed a lot of mothballs and air-fresheners around the toilet area as it is evident the owners are aware of the odd smell issues. We slept without aircon the first night and noticed the occasional stench wafting through. We had the aircon on for the second night and it wasn't as noticeable. 

The hotel discourages guests bringing children which is fine as we wanted a quiet time without screaming children. Unfortunately they sometimes have problems controlling their own 4 year old daughter who would usually stay in the reception or their own residence upstairs but was very audible one morning which disturbed the peace and quiet for about 10 minutes. It wasn't terrible and I understand it is difficult to control a young child and it would be wrong to confine her to a room only.

I would highly recommend The Puncak to any couples looking for a quiet retreat.
title: Private and personal

owner_response.text:
Dear Guests, 

Thank you for your description and comments. Like you wrote, we are working hard, as well as our staff to make from your stay a private and personal experience in a cozy and high exclusive atmosphere. Our successful goal is to be assisted by a limited but efficient staff and this is a daily concern in order to keep a high level of tranquility.

To reply on your slight complaints :
We are situated in an extreme location.  Imagine the challenge we had to build this minimalistic project on the top of a hill.   There is nothing wrong on the plumbings as we were present when the plumbings were placed during the construction.  There is no other alternative then the use of septic tanks build up according to international standards.  It happens there is an interconnection with weather conditions, for instance sometimes after rainfall there can be a lightly smell.  So far we have this under control and we are very aware and proactive even for issues we cannot always completely control.

Our 4 year young daughter is part of The Puncak.  It is our commitment to keep her far away from the guests in order not to 'disturb'.  Rarely it happens that she is over enthusiastic and makes some fun.  We accept complaints with open hands to improve our accommodation and thus we consider that it would be more wise to talk about hotel issues either then matters which are affecting us in personal way.  We would more appreciate if you were talking about this  to us directly !
The presence of our daughter has nothing to see with our hotel policy about children.

Kind regards.

Jean-Paul & Nury and Sorenza
The Puncak owners
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: stayed here for 5 nights in june and the place is exactly how people describe it , very good in every aspect , the only gripe for me as previously mentioned was the noisy staff only feet away from the sundeck in the kitchen , one day whilst waiting in paradise for the famous sunset the owners 4 year old was making a continuous noise from the kitchen behind the sundeck for over 15 minutes , i stood up and gestured to the staff who were grinning out of the window at me stop b ut took no notice , the owner would not allow this if he was there but he was not as we saw him go out for the evening , this should not however stop you from visiting this magical place .
title: as expected

owner_response.text:
Dear Dorestboy,

We are thanking you for your review and happy we could fulfill your expectations.
We are apologizing for the noise experienced during your stay.
Our child is not supposed to be in the area of staff. Our staff is clearly briefed about many issues but of course it is not always possible to keep the standards at the highest level.
We were not in the hotel that time, as we are many times having duty to our suppliers and markets.   Many times when we are not present, even only for a short time, little things can happen wrong, as The Puncak is only Excellent when we are present, which is not an easy issue.

Anyway thank you again - we are really following up every remark good or lesser good in order to keep - if possible and reasonable - our level of Excellence.

Jean-Paul & Nury
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Its only when you leave the Puncak that you realize how good it is. Lovely rooms, decorated with individual stones look out over an amazing view, of the bay below. The experience starts with the welcome drink, beautifully done and carries on with the sunset drink and a breakfast that looks as good as it tastes. Staff are friendly and helpful. On top of a hill, the hotel is  only a short taxi ride into town. Its also nice to have a small botique hotel with 5 rooms and lots of individual atention. Thx.
title: Superb

text:
From the moment you arrive until you leave, all the staff are very friendly. Jean-Paul is a very attentive host and always makes sure you're enjoying your stay and has a very warm smile. 

The view is absolutely stunning. One of the best we have experienced. The small infinity pool outside the room provides a lovely refreshing g escape from the sun. The loungers are v comfortable and allow you to relax in peace. 

The food on offer is excellent although at the top end of local prices. The hotel is a taxi ride from the town and no outside food is allowed so you will be reliant on the lovingly cooked food on offer. Fish curry and homemade beef burger were excellent. Also, on one day, lunch wasn't available as the owners were out and we were only told at 12.30 so we had no time to make other plans. luckily the breakfast is massive so we didn't starve!

If I could change one small thing, it would be for the staff to be a little quieter during the day. The kitchen area is right behind the sun deck and they are quite noisy which disturbs the lovely peace and quiet. 

This place is for you if you're after a comfy bed with great views and very friendly staff and like the feel of small boutique accommodation.
title: Stunning view, friendly staff and lush food

text: Beautiful location,fantastic rooms very clean.just in front of the room we could enjoy the swimming pool,with a beautiful view of the bay. Perfect breakfast served just outside the room. Very nice staff. The only thing to notice is that they do not accept credit cards.
title: Beatiful!!

text: It's a very nice place that I visited during our trip to Bali and Lombok, The atmosphere are just perfect, the service was great, very friendly staffs, I wish that I could stay a little bit longer to enjoy it all more. Just stayed 1 night with my husband but we will be back to stay more longer in Puncak.
title: Great place and will back to stay longer

text:
What i can say about the puncak is what most people will agree, the location is absolutely fantastic. Probably i am disappointed by the weather on that day - cloudy. So i could not see the beautiful sunset that was so highly reviewed. The service was excellent and jean paul is such a gd host that he brings you to your room and explain to you each and every part of it.
there was an mini blackout while we were slping which last about 10 mins but jean paul did  mentioned about blackouts happening (not frequent) when he introduce his hotel room to us.
Forget to mention about the 2 dogs running around the hotel when we first arrived, they were friendly, but my GF is afraid of dogs, thus the stuff tried their best to prevent the dogs from coming to our room.
As for the food served by the hotel for dinner, i ordered a burger and i taste normal, nothing "wow"  about that. My GF ordered curry chicken, the curry is nice but probably they should have used chicken leg meat would be better.

For breakfast, it was just fantastic. A lot of variety.. Probably the best breakfast i had in a hotel.
Thanks Jean Paul
title: Fantastic location with Gd service

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your comment -
We are sorry for the weather, we are trying to control our business as much as we can, but we have no power on this issue and not yet able to pitch lighting and colours of sunsets.
About your dinner, Nury was satisfied to see that your dishes returned empty. 
She was even sorry not to be able to provide more curry sauce as wished by your girlfriend.
Taste of food is something subjective for a wow or none wow appreciation.
Thank you for your suggestion about the chicken curry. Please note that we are coping with international public and mostly guests have a preference for fillet either then the original way.

Sincere regards,

Jean-Paul & Nury
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We travelled as a couple, stayed for 2 nights between Gili Trawangan and Bali.

The Puncak is magic. We didn't leave the hotel at all, just staying on the terrace, enjoying the view, the peace, the amazing, fresh & tasty food and warm service. 
Perfect for couples or even better, if you are a group you can rent all 5 rooms and have a top level private surrounding .... 
The best place we stayed during our whole trip. 

The beaches, street and city looked like it's in the beginning of developement, you won't find fancy restaurants and boutiques like on Bali - but I believe Lombok is going to break thru soon and for us Puncak is the heart of this great Island...

B&T
title: A perfect oasis with great view, food & service

text: We stayed at the Puncak for the second part of our honeymoon, and it was wonderful.  The location is awe-inspiring, with the most stunning views, and it was a great place to retreat to from Senggigi.  The breakfasts were huge, and beautifully presented, with fantastic service from all the staff.  The games provided on the outside tables were a nice touch, and we enjoyed a gin  and tonic with our game of cards, while watching the sun go down before heading out in the evening for dinner.  The trip to the Gilis for snorkelling was one of the best things we did, and we also enjoyed a trip around southern Lombok.  The rooms are very comfortable and well-equipped, and there is an air of clam about the place, we loved it!
title: fantastic stay

text:
This lovely 5 room hotel has everything going for it.  Jean Paul and Nuri are the most gracious hosts.  They employ a staff that they have nutured and the results are amazing, friendly and efficient, they go the extra mile to please.  Thank you Erna and Indah for being such wonderful hostesses.  The view is spectacular.  The food was the best on the island.  All of our tours were organized by The Pumcak staff, including a car and an English speaking driver.
Lombok is like Bali was twenty years ago....serene, uncluttered and quite religious.
Note:  wine is not readily available for sale.  Let Jean Paul know your preference in advance.

Thank you Jean Paul and Nuri, your love for your hotel and your guests is obvious in everything you do.
title: Exquisite boutique hotel with excellent service.

owner_response.text:
Dear Barbinbarbados,

Thank you for your review and your appreciation.  We have shared with our staff .  It was a real pleasure to have you as our valued guests, positive and enjoying your stay with us.

We wish to see you again in Lombok and back with us in The Puncak.

Kindest regards,

Jean-Paul & Nury
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
What an experience. We arrived home this morning after 5night Bali, 4night lombok, 2night Bali holiday. The 4 night in Lombok were spent at 'The Puncak'. 
OMG!! Amazing accomodation and everything else that has been mentioned in the previous positive reviews. 
I see this place as a dream that has been created with passion and love, including (perhaps especially the food) The breakfasts, as previously mentioned were set up to give you all of the digestive health to help you through the day. I love the added yakult, a necessary for us the morning after we had come back from a BIT (ahem) of a party night at the 'Happy cafe' I lost count of the amount of pina coladas and barely remember the stagger up the entry steps at 2ish or 3ish am. woke up to the tour we had booked leaving at nine am with a major hangover, forced some of my' personal buffet' breakfast in to me and managed to cope with and thoroughly enjoy my 8 hr tour to the first two waterfalls. Its a hike at the best of times for two overweight 40ish couple (1  chain smoker). 
This place is designed for tranquility and health, you totally relax even though you have many tours during the day. We made sure that we were the villa for sunset. I cant imagine a better sunset anywhere in the world.
The staff were amazing, in the background and respectful of privacy, but also onhand when we needed anything. Erna (who worked afternoon during our stay) was always available when we felt like a chat and a laugh, I think its impossible not to fall in love with her and the rest of the 
staff that we didnt get to know so much, as we had booked activities during the day.
The mornig that I realised the cut to my big was bleeding again,Ross went to ask for  bandaid/plaster to help get me through the day on the boat trip we had booked to two of the Gilli Islands ( I recommend a boat from Senneggi beach due to the scenery, takes about an hour) he came back with Triya?? and that lovely girl from the kitchen that helps Nuyi. WELL talk about effort, we had great sport trying to bandage/plaster/dissinfect my cut so that I could get the most from my day. Wow for caring!!!!! 
Absolutely no probs from us about the remoteness of this villa. we read the earlier reviews 'trip adviser' before we went there.In fact we loved the place so much, we enjoyed the taxi rides to Senneggi main area and set aside IDR20,000 even though the taxis cost IDR14,000 to 15,000.
TIPS
1. just experience Jean Paul and Nury's dream. 
2. You must have a Pina colada near the pools or IN one at sunset.
3. If you wanna party grab a taxi and head downhill. 
4. From earlier reviews, we understood that the AIRPORT moved, so trip to Puncak is about 40 mins, more from sea travel ex Bali.
5. Puncak (meaning summit) is pronounced punch_ak. We chose to get a private driver due to a previous review saying diffficult to find, dont think thats a prob anymore (puncak only 2 yrs old)
6. Its WORTH the isolation. I dont believe its Just a romantic thing (we saw the exitement on the the family group that took up at least 2 rooms on the morning we checked out)
7. If you want another jug of water, ASK!!!
8. If you want to explore your mind, body and soul book this place
9. If you want to just have a speciel holiday from the holiday ... grab a couple of days

I believe that the next time we want time in ' The Puncak' its going to be difficult to get a space, get in now before its impossible or difficult to book
title: I have never cried leaving hotel accomodation before!!

text:
1. view is fantastic. I have never seen such great seaview from top of the mountain.
2. infinite swimming pool is always available, and water is warm even at night time.
3. big yummy breakfast. I really miss it. (western, or indonesian food, and there are at least  5cups for your breakfast, lime   water,yogurt, juice,milk, tea or coffee,,,)
4. very freindly, and lovely staff. I felt them like my friends)
   (I left my camera in the taxi, but the doorman checked my seat, and gave it to me.
    I really appreciate it. thanks again)

in the Puncak, u will feel someting totally different from your reality.
title: uique boutique hotel.

photos.caption: big breakfast just infront of your room

text: Where should we start! Location-divine! Breakfast-10/10, Service-the staff at the Puncak were amazing, they were always ready to help and so attentive to our needs. Even the security guard, what a legend, the biggest guy in Indonesia, he even helped us with our motorbike and always opened our taxi door! Jean Paul & Nury, are very lovely, and no stone is left unturned at this remarkable boutique hotel. The Puncak is located in one of the best spots in Lombok and is perfect for couples looking to get away from it all. Lombok is paradise, you must hire out a motorcycle and ride up the coast, stopping at the secluded beaches along the way. My Fiancé organised a romantic dinner with help from the staff. I was so surprised, the food was perfect, and the set up was beautiful (candles & flowers in a heart shape was a lovely touch). In our opinion, I wouldn't listen to the negative comment below. The service and the food were 10/10 and the staff do all they can to help you. Thankyou Puncak we had an unforgettable stay, we will be sure to recommend you to all of our friends in Australia. Jamie and Ash
title: A magic place :)

text:
We traveled 16 hours (including a 4 hour flight delay) to get to the Puncak but my wife and I agree that it was well worth the trip. The way the hotel was constructed took full advantage of its location. Perched at the top of a midsized hill, you can see the marvelous Lombok landscape from any part of the hotel. And because there are only 5 rooms, you can really kick back and enjoy the view. 

The atmosphere created by Jean-Paul and his staff contributes to the overall vibe of the place. They're there when you need them and they won't hesitate to share a story or two with you but they are never overbearing or nosy. 

The rooms are fantastic - quite clean and spacious for two people. Maybe the only complaint is that the cable tv reception is faulty. (but, really, one shouldnt spend so
much time watching tv in a place like this!). 

The Puncak is not for everyone - its not for families with small children, its not for people looking to meet other people and hang and party in their hotel rooms. It's for people who want to escape the hustle and bustle of life for a few days and just relax.
title: Definitely coming back and staying longer next time

owner_response.text:
Dear Mr Tim Limgenco,

Thank you for your interesting review and your appreciation.  Our Staff, Nury and me are feeling delighted when our guests are having that special emotion as a remember of their stay in The Puncak.   The success of our place is a collaboration and synergy with the staff, but especially also Nury's organization, final touches and inputs and kitchen ( never finished before 2 at night and starting again at 5 in the morning).  

About the television cable,  we would have appreciated if you told us during your stay and fix directly any faultiness.  After reading your review - as we always looking for improvements - we have checked, but the satellite connected LED televisions are operational and well working in all of our rooms.

Anyway, we are wishing you all the best and looking forward to see you again in The Puncak, Lombok.

Kind regards,

Jean-Paul.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: The Puncak is the most wonderful hotel! It is in a strange location (Up a steep dirt track hill but do not let this put you off... the view is most certainly worth it!) As soon as we arrived we were greeted with smiles and friendly faces! The rooms are very modern with a double bathroom, excellent shower and lovely extras. You can see the ocean from your bed! The infinity pools are amazing (We had the pool to ourselves!) A great little sun trap to catch a nice sun tan! The sunset is to die for! The food is lovely and staff are extremely helpful. We had a couple of power cuts which lasted around an hour each night but the hotel puts candles around the hotel which makes it very romantic! Only thing.. if you are afraid of dogs this may not be the best resort as they have 2 guard dogs and another dog (All very harmless but a little intimidating!) If you are visiting Lombok then definitely stay at the Puncak. 5 star accomodation!
title: A lovely modern hotel....

text: The views from this place are fantastic, the rooms are spacious and nicely designed and the grounds and facilities are very modern and stylish.  These all add up to make it a very relaxing place to stay.  However, if you are expecting the type of service you would expect from a hotel, look elsewhere.  As described on their website, these are 'boutique rooms' rather than a hotel and the services and facilities are accordingly quite limited.  The food is average, not good value and the menu extremely limited.  The catering service is also unbelievably slow - we ordered a plate of fries the evening we arrived and it took one hour to arrive!  Food is best ordered long in advance and in fact breakfast and some dishes on the menu have to be ordered the day before.  This left us with a slight delimma as to what to do in the evenings, since the rest of Senggigi is a taxi ride away from the hotel.  The junior staff are very friendly and attentive, but it is clear that they are restricted by some rather less hospitable orders from above.  For instance, on the day we checked out we arranged to use one of their showers to clean off the suntan lotion and sweat before we left.  However, the staff removed the towels we had been using and, when we asked for another from the managers, they kicked up a fuss and only let us have one (for 3 people!).  Not a great note to leave on.  Also, I have never before stayed somewhere where you have to pay for small plastic bottles of water.  Not only that, but they charged us about Rp 15,000 for a bottle, which one can pick up for about RP 3,000 at the bottom of the hill.  All in all, a great location, but let down by the service.
title: Beautiful location and great rooms and grounds, but let down by the service

owner_response.text:
Dear Bobster133,

We remember you.  From the moment you arrived we could feel a negative energy and an attitude of difficult to please people,  even with our high standard  that discerning people will understand.   We have to clarify :

Yes, we are a small boutique place and that's why so many from our guests were pleased with the private service they have received.
You have ordered once at a moment that we had a technical problem in our kitchen.  That  late evening we needed some more time to prepare your order.  We have apologized for that ;

About ordering food in advance : this is only our recommendation to order in advance. We provide  fresh ingredients, daily from the market and we prepare with love and emotion, as we (Nury) are cooking for our guests with an important more value in the quality and taste of our dishes.  We explained this clearly to you but apparently you didn't pay attention to our welcome words ;

About your check out : check out is at 12.00 - Late check out is possible, a late check out fee applies. One of you asking to use the room a few hours after check out to take a shower.  However we had to prepare the room for a next arriving guest, we allowed that person to use the room and we provide 1 towel for 1 person.  Finally, all of you, 3 persons were taking a shower.  If we knew in advance we would provide 3 towels.  But you didnt mention it.  Above that we didn't count any late check out fee .... Where is the problem worth to discuss about ? ; 

About Mineral water :  we provide in all our rooms mineral water for free in a jarre and you may ask as much as you need.  We avoid plastic bottles for eco-friendly reasons.  If you take a bottle from the minibar of the room, it is normal that you have to pay our clearly published price for it, isnt it ?  If you want to buy a bottle outside the hotel, yes, it will be more cheap, however if you count the price of transport to the shop and back, it will be probaly even more expensive.  Where  is the problem ?

Even with our personal high level service & our personal daily touch, our 24 hrs commitment,
Nury and me wondering since long time ' when do we finally will have a lesser good comment on tripadvisor ?.... well you got the price ;-)    Just a few minutes ago a couple from Germany left us with tears in the eyes .... and we also had our tears..... that's how it works in The Puncak, with attention and emotion .....  apparently you didn't understand  our commitment of availability and our wish to make our guests feeling home and happy ....   

Jean-Paul and Nury
Owners
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Everything is excellent and tranquil at this luxury resort in the lush hills above Sengiggi.  Spoil yourself and visit the Puncak for amazing accommodation and fabulous food at very reasonable prices.  Can't say enough good things about Jean Paul & Nuri and their friendly, competent staff and the attention to detail which makes the Puncak perfect.
title: Paradise on the hill!

text: Thanks to Trip Advisor, I was lucky to choose the Puncak. My visit was superb in every way. Luxurious rooms, beautiful infinity pools with a stunning view of the Indian Ocean, and friendly, professional, attentive service. I am a single female traveller and never once felt overlooked. Jean Paul and Nuri made me feel right at home. Their goal is to make all of their guests as comfortable and as happy as they can possibly be. As there were no restaurants right nearby, it is a tremendous boost to be staying in this place, which has an excellent kitchen and diversified menu. If you want something off the menu, all you must do is ask. The last night I was there, I requested two classic Indonesian dishes. Nuri's rendition was beautiful to look at and delicious to taste. I hope to go back before very long.
title: International Service in a stunning Indonesian setting

text: As soon as we arrived, we wished we could stay longer! The rooms are stylish and spacious with stunning ocean views. Jean Paul and Nuri are superb hosts. Like the previous reviewer, I am also vegetarian and Nuri very kindly created some delicious dishes for me. In fact, the food was the best we had during our entire stay on the island. Jean Paul also helped us to organise our hike up Mt Rinjani which went very smoothly. So if you want to stay somewhere quiet, with excellent food and service this place should be first on your list!
title: Fantastic

owner_response.text:
Dear guests,

We hope that your Rinjani trekking after your journey in The Puncak was also a fantastic experience !  Like most of ranked places looking to offer the best quality - we are working with accuracy on technical issues, but above all that we are caring and involving our emotions and love (agape) in all our services towards our valued guests.  That makes an important difference. Thank you for being with us and for your feedback.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
My husband and I stayed at the hotel for my birthday and had the best time ever. The room was amazing and the views breathtaking. Jean Paul and Nuri were simply the best hosts. We both are vegetarian and I am especially picky - and Nuri was easily able to accommodate our needs and whip up some very nice vegetarian versions of their signature dishes - veggie tom yam soup, lumpia, spicy pasta. Very quiet and very helpful staff. Convenient ride to town to eat at some of the other restaurants. Will deifnitely go back and stay here.
Room is very modern and has state of the art amenities. Great lighting and the pool is fabulous.
title: Excellent hotel - and is vegetarian friendly

text:
I’ll start by saying that if you’re planning to visit Lombok any time soon, just book this place now! Once people get to know about this amazing new hilltop hideaway, demand is likely to be huge, and with only 5 rooms, many will be disappointed.

And what rooms! Each is excellently appointed and very spacious, with a huge bed facing out through the full wall-to-ceiling sliding glass panels. The architect has certainly taken full advantage of this prime location, high in the hills looking out across the vast bay below, with swaying palm trees in the foreground, the perfect sunset shot was just waiting to happen! It’s only a short taxi ride up the hill from the town but it is well worth it for the quiet tranquility, away from the hustle and bustle of traffic noise.
After being received on our arrival by the very friendly and convivial Belgian owner, Jean-Paul, he took it upon himself to personally show us to our room and guide us through the state-of-the-art facilities provided. Then it was straight into one of the two infinity pools in front of the rooms (yes, that’s 2 pools for 5 rooms!) for a relaxing swim and to wait for the sunset on our terrace.
The attention to our needs was exceptional in every detail and not just from Jean-Paul. The highly trained young staff were extremely attentive without being at all intrusive, and genuinely friendly and wanting to chat with us, clearly brushing up on their English! Indeed the whole place had a very relaxed, laid back atmosphere, far more preferable in my opinion to some of the more ‘stuffy’ and formal five star places we have stayed in.

And unlike the buffet-style hotel breakfasts, these breakfasts were truly excellent, with a stunning selection of chopped fresh fruits, pastries, fruit juices and eggs, all freshly prepared and presented on our terrace each morning. Wonderful.

Dinner was also memorable, (we ate there twice in 4 nights) freshly prepared by Jean-Paul’s wife Nuri, from a small but varied menu offering both Indonesian and Western dishes, which we enjoyed immensely. We chose to have it served on our terrace, but there was always the option to dine in the well- appointed outdoor restaurant area which also overlooked the bay. And when we dined out the following evening, Jean Paul had several recommendations for us and even summoned the taxi, a ridiculously cheap ten-minute ride down into the hustle and bustle of the town. And his recommendations didn't disappoint!
We were intially only there for 4 nights, but as we were returning to the island a few days later for a pre-departure overnight stay, we had no hesitation in booking the Puncak over the larger hotels down in the town.

To sum up, we saw a lot of Indonesia in a 3 week period and stayed in some pretty up-market places, but nothing like the Puncak. This place is luxurious, classy, cool and very laid back, a great place to unwind and be pampered. Thanks, Jean-Paul and Nuri, for making us so welcome!
title: “Stunning views, amazing place, excellent service, book it now!”

owner_response.text: Dear valued guests, Mr & Mrs E.Y. W., we have shared your review with our staff.  It is always giving a warm and good feeling to receive such a feedback and to experience the enjoyment from our guests  Thank you for your appreciation.  With passion and duty we are focusing on keeping on our standards of excellence .  We wish to see you again in the future.   Sincere regards,
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Fantastic rooms; spacious and superbly furnished; very stylish.  The 'monsoon' shower was unbelievable.  Very comfortable, friendly welcoming staff and stunning location; we loved the long, narrow pools.  Breakfast was the stuff of legends; very generous and beautifully presented.  The Puncak is quite a way from anywhere else which became a mixed blessing as we always needed a taxi to go to and fro and they didn't always know where the hotel was on our return!  The Puncak is definitely a place to go for peace and quiet though the dinner menu is very limited and ordinary; a bit of a let down as we found we preferred to go out to dinner - yet another taxi ride.
title: Superbe

owner_response.text:
Dear reviewer,

Thank you for your time on TripAdvisor.  As reviewers are signing with another Traveler name, we do not always recognize the origin of the review.  Some people are giving comments on services they even didn't use...

The Puncak is situated on the top of the main Senggigi Hill.  From our top you can see Senggigi Beach, the beautiful Senggigi Riff and the very nice shaped coastal line.  The Puncak is a hidden place at 5 minutes of Senggigi area and - so far - Senggigi is still the main touristic attraction of Lombok .  Of course if you want to visit the south or the north or the Gilis, you need a taxi or another transportation like it is the case for all the hotels or villas. If you want to stay in the middle of the Senggigi attraction you have to choose a hotel in the center which will be probably much lesser charming...
You can also hire a motorbike or a car as a  service that The Puncak can provide you, making your drive very independent, fun and original…. driving in all directions of this beautiful island.
The use of taxi and especially the Blue Bird in Lombok is very easy and cheap and reliable for many visitors wherever the place they stay in Lombok.

The menu in the restaurant of The Puncak is a limited choice but high quality with some originals you cannot find anywhere else in Lombok – we have Belgian, Italian, Oriental and Indonesian.  The choice is limited only because of quality reasons as  you can read in other reviews showing the special appreciation of many guests.  Please note this is not our core business as our restaurant is only a complementary  service to our guests and not available for public.  
The Puncak is a small and charming boutique hotel focusing on quality in all issues, tranquility, intimacy, privacy and high quality standards of food.  Small number of exceptional rooms, small but delicious menu,  don't wait to long for visiting us and sharing our unique atmosphere...

Sincere regards to all of you,
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
we stayed in the green stone room which is at the very last room on the venue. when we arrived, already We were so happy to see how reception area is built.it was like floating in the sky! 
staff and the owner were very warm and welcoming. the owner took us to the room and explained room facilities.
 *Room*
It was much bigger than we thought and much better than it seems in the photos! big rain shower and big bed,big mirror space and candles(thought we didn't have chance to use....)nice bath robe and big bath towels,proper hot water....everything were just great! I think we had the best room since it was on the end of 3rooms beside infinity room which means no body would pass by on their way to get their room from reception/entrance. its just already too much to ask,but if there were a bath tab, it would be more than perfect!

*breakfast* 
We could choose "indonesian/western meal"."eating at your room/eating space next to reception(though it seemed no body was using that area...). We choose to have it at our balcony next to their beautiful infinity pool and great hill top view. every morning it was just like a heaven to spend such a beautiful time with great meal. both indonesian meal(nashi gore/mi goren) and western meal(croissant was just killing me every morning...)were amazing.big potion and quality food.We simply loved everything about breakfast.

*Food* 
We ordered room service. had burger and cream sauce pasta. it was the best meal in lombok!!!!! very proper and thick taste,we loved it!!!! the puncak is located on the hill top,but we rent a bike and it took us just around 10min to get center area. we definitely would like to come back to the puncak even though lombok itself has not much to do, it worth to go just to stay in the puncak relaxing and enjoying beautiful pool,comfortable room and beautiful view. best place for couple! if you want to party maybe its not the place since its very quiet romantic place:o)
SUNSET WAS STUNNING!
title: Great Vila

owner_response.text:
Dear guests,

Thank you for your appreciation and detailed description.  Just note that The Puncak, Lombok is a boutique hotel, small and cozy, focusing on privacy - tranquility and intimacy, hower it looks like a Villa, it isn't in the definition of our activity, however we try to make you feeling like home... like in your own villa... 
We are looking forward to see you again.
Our kindest regards.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Stayed here for 5N during the Dec holidays, absolutely no regrets. My wife and I had a wonderful time relaxing and enjoying what Lombok had to offer. With such value for money, The Puncak was without doubt the best resting haven after a day's worth of activities.

View is spectacular (gorgeous sunset each day), and while it may be a chore to some to get a taxi down to the main rd, its worth it as taxis there are cheap and metered. Wonderful seafood places arnd Jln Raya Senggigi, and our fav had to be Warung Manega (try their red snapper!) and Warung Kangen.

JP, our friendly host and owner of the place, can also help you book several tours around Lombok,and we went for the snorkelling trip to the Gilis. Our local guide, Jas, was great, sharing his vast local knowledgr without being too intrusive, allowing my wife and I to enjoy our time together.

JP and Nury were wonderful hosts, and pls relay our shout out to Erna, Rully and Tria for their wonderful help, greeting us by our name and sharing their knowledge of good food and beautiful places arnd Senggigi and Lombok as a whole. Not forgetting Jas our snorkel guide and the boys from the beach restaurant in Gili Meno.

Highly recommended.

Ridzuan & Nisa.
title: Mesmerising

text: I stayed for a full 10 days at The Puncak in August 2011 and it was the most amazing vacation ever. The place is just stunning and the service is excellent. Jean-Paul and Nori are the most wonderful hosts and are always very helpful. The prices are very reasonable, the hospitality and food are excellent and the rooms are extremely unique. I highly recommend this place to anyone, especially if you want the ultimate special vacation in paradise at an affordable price. A must!!!
title: Amazing place!!!!!!!

text:
Me and My Wife stayed at The Puncak for 3 nights. We booked for the hotel through AGODA. The owner Jean Paul and his wife Nory stay at the hotel and rightly called themselves our next door neighbours. The staff was excellent- Rully, Erna and Tria are all very friendly and are just around the corner eager to help. The location is absoultely amazing. A bit hard on the vehicles sometime to get there, but it all is secondary once on top of the hill looking out over the sea. The hotel is bound by infinity pools and great accessories. We found the entertainment features to be excellent, the room houses a TV, Satellite connection and a Home theater system. We stayed in the Big blue room which has a giant stone hung above the bed. Every morning we were served a huge breakfast, actually huge, which was served at our own porch looking out over the ocean, very relaxing. We need to order a taxi to go to town which costs around 15k rupiah about 1.5 dollars. We took a hotel organised trip to the Senaru waterfalls which was the best place we went to in Indonesia. The hotel provided us with a cool box for our trip. Overall the hotel was awesome, with a view of the Lombok Strait, which for me as a seafarer, is of importance as it the route to Australia for ships bound from Singapore. We could actually see Mount Agung of BALI from our room. Thanks for making our stay at Lombok a pleasurable one.

Mithil and Pradnya
title: Great View from a Good Hotel

text: A truly fantastic stay at the puncak in lombok. after a difficult night on gili meno it was wonderful to relax in the beautiful surroundings of this hotel. The staff we're fantastic, and we're extremely helpful when I lost my telephone. We thoroughly recommend staying here
title: excellent stay

text: We had a lovely stay at The Puncak for a too-short weekend away from Jakarta. We had found the hotel from this site, and booked through the owners who were supremely helpful and friendly during the stay. The location is one of the selling points- on top of a hill looking out over the sea in a quiet area- as is the actual hotel which includes infinity pools, water features and luxurious rooms. A unique fetaure of the rooms is a giant piece if laporodite that is hung above the bed and is really beautiful to look at. Every morning we were served a huge breakfast which we could enjoy from the porch of our room, looking out over the ocean, very relaxing. The only downfall was that the Puncak is some distance from the centre of Sengiggi town, which is where you need to go to get lunch/dinner. You need to order a taxi (which the staff will do for you) or do like we did and hire a motorbike to get around on for ease of transport. Otherwise, the service was fantastic, the rooms were very comfortable, the view is priceless, the breakfast was fab, and it is also very good value for money for the quality you receive. Recommended!
title: Beautiful view from luxurious accommodation

owner_response.text:
Dear guests,

Thank you so much for your edifying comments.  
Our staff, Nury and myself are very proud to give you the good feelings and vibes that you are looking for during a holiday stay and we will always hard working to make from your stay in The Puncak that special remember making the difference ...
The Puncak is situated on top of the Hill , at 200 m above sea level, that makes the place so unique, but in the same time close to all possible activities, and only 5 minutes from Senggigi village & the beaches - the special location of The Puncak is a perfect compromise between being getaway and close to all activities (day trip departures, water sports, night cafes, ... )
According to many of our guests The Puncak has an exquisite kitchen and thus there is no need to dinner every night outside.  Taxis are easy available and will drive you right down to fish restaurants, Indonesian, Italian, Indian or international restaurants, all in only a few minutes time. text: perfect service , neatness . beautifull sight and exquise design. owner with his wife  makes you feel welcome in a world of calm and beauty.
title: enjoying sengigi

text:
The Puncak is really in a class of its own and is certainly the most enjoyable hotel I have stayed at in the region.  

First, the location is superb: atop a hill and overlooking the bay, every room has a breathtaking view of the bay 100 meters below.

Secondly, the hotel itself is truly beautiful.  If you have the pleasure of arriving after sunset, you'll be greeted my a magnificently lit flight of stairs leading to a majestic reception.  From that point, you'll be taken to exquisitely decorated rooms that perfectly unite modern life comforts and a local quiet ambiance.

And last, but mot least, the owner Jean-Paul is exceptionally friendly and helpful,  He clearly enjoys running his perfect boutique hotel and spares no effort so that his guests enjoy a truly memorable stay.

We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Lombok.
title: In a class of its own

text:
I travel with my hubby to Lombok, and decided to stay at this hotel because of the excellent review from the TA reviewers. We booked directly to Jean Paul and Nury the owners of this hotel by sending them email to thepuncaklombok@gmail.com.

The hotel located on a hill, has the best view of Sunset. Yet it is only 10 minutes away by taxi to Senggigi central, where we can find good cafe and resto; The Square for International and Indonesian dishes, Happy Cafe for its dragon roll and also the live music or Alberto resto for the Italian Pizza. We can ask the hotel staff to book Blue Bird Taxi for us. We may have to pay minimum taxi fare as we booked it by phone, if I'm not mistaken, it's about IDR 25,000.

The hotel has only 5 rooms, so it's very quiet at the hotel. The room has a king koil bed, king koil pillows, nice bathroom, and also very nice smell. All the rooms are ocean view room, which we can enjoy the view from our bed! 

Jean Paul, Nury and all the staffs were really helpful and friendly. We checked out at 3.30 am for our early flight, and Jean Paul woke up just to say goodbye to us. 

We rented a car, and the hotel has a parking place for our car. I might not suggest renting  a motorcycle as we have to pass the hilly road.

From Bandara Internasional Lombok ('BIL'), the hotel is about 75 minutes drive by car. We can go to Senggigi by airport bus (IDR 25,000 per person), than continue taking taxi to this hotel once we arrive at the bus stop. Or directly take taxi which cost IDR 175,000. For those who prefer private car, the rate from BIL to the hotel is about IDR 300,000 one way.

If you would like to go to Gili Trawangan from The Puncak, the Bangasal (the harbour) is about 45 minutes until 1 hour drive by car, than we can continue taking public boat to Gili Trawangan (IDR 10,000 per person).

I have made a full review of this hotel in our food and travel blog www.tesyasblog.com with the link: http://www.tesyasblog.com/2011/11/puncak-lombok.html  We will also upload our Lombok travel experience on our blog.
title: A hotel I called "home"

text:
Great view ontop of mountain. away from traffic noise. great breakfast. excellent owner and staff. This hotel was custom made. large sliding glass doors, very large glass walkin shower.
Very Quiet. They also have a doberman watch dog excuse my spelling
title: Great hotel on top of mountain.

text:
We have just spent three nights at The Puncak while on vacation in Lombok, and we cannot say enough good things about it. Both Jean-Paul and Nury, the owners, have created a wonderful retreat atop a mountain ridge looking west to Bali. We enjoyed the sublime views, especially watching the sunset every night from the private area outside our room. 

As other reviewers have said, the five rooms are individually decorated with careful attention to color, design and comfort. While the setting is outstanding, the most important qualities are the service and attention to detail. Erna took care of our every desire without being intrusive, and Jean-Paul and Nury were willing to drop everything and help us arrange a boat trip with picnic and snorkeling on the spur of the moment. The breakfasts are divine....

To mention a few things that other reviewers might have missed:  We give The Puncak an A+ on wi-fi and t.v. connections. Wi-fi was swift and always available. We spent mornings sitting outside admiring the view and writing or reading (yes, it was most peaceful). Although we could not imagine watching T.V. in such a wonderful place, we  did occasionally watch the news. Selection of channels and reception were exceptional compared to other places we stayed. And when we were ready to explore, the beach or the traditional market were a short (and inexpensive) cab ride away.  We had an unbeatable combination of privacy and access to the rest of the island.

In short, we cannot come up with any complaints about this wonderful place. If in Lombok, we will return, and we will send our friends.  Highly recommended. R & V
title: Couldn't Be Better

text:
My wife and I were fortunate enough to stay at the Puncak for 5 nights and it was wonderful.  The villa is on top of the hill that overlooks Senggigi.  As a result, you get great views of the water, sunsets and you're away from what little hustle and bustle exists in Senggigi. We spent our last days in Indonesia here and took the opportunity to simply relax.

If you have any questions, simply ask J-P.  He was always happy to answer all our questions.  Nury and J-P have built an amazing villa and hired some wonderful people that made our stay even more memoriable. 

Helpful suggestions:  While at the Puncak, we spent two days exploring Lombok with a local guide named Eko.  J-P can easily arrange your introduction.  Eko took us to the north part of the island on our first day to explore some waterfalls and visit some local markets.  On the second day, he took us snorkling in the Gili Islands.  While visiting Senggigi, we ate at a very good restaurant called Square.  Definitely worth a visit.  We also ate at Warung Manega while is just south on the main road and located on the beach.  You can get a fish dinner with all the fixings for 90 Rp which was alright.  The taxi ride into two was about $2 or $3. If you're looking for gifts to take home, I'd suggest buying them in Bali.

J-P and Nury were great hosts and we'd recommend the Puncak to anyone!
title: Relax and enjoy the sunset....

text:
Our stay at The Puncak was originally for three nights, but after arriving at this idyllic villa, we extended to six nights. We wouldve stayed longer if we'd had the time! The Puncak is simply a divine place to stay. The spacious rooms have been tastefully designed and includes a huge king size bed - the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. 

From the bedroom and through the floor to ceiling sliding glass doors are breathtaking views of the ocean which encompass glowing sunsets. In fact, the views are available anywhere in the Puncak - whether you are in the intimate restaurant, on the deck chairs or in the pool. And with two infinity pools for only five rooms, you are assured of a relaxing place for a swim.

The hospitality of our hosts Jean-Paul and Nury and their attention to detail was just outstanding. When we wanted some information, they made enquires immediately. When we needed collection from the port, they sent a driver without hesitation, even though we could not confirm by email promptly. When we went out on an activity that started at 5am, they prepared a wonderful fresh breakfast box for us to take on the trip.  They really care about the experience of their guests and it shows.

The food available for lunch and dinner was great  especially the beef burger! The included breakfast was filling and fantastic. Fresh fruit, juice, yoghurt followed by fresh croissants, bread, eggs, coffee and cheese. On our last evening Jean-Paul and Nury prepared a candlelight dinner for two guests which was so beautifully presented in an outdoor setting. 

If you are looking for the most relaxing and beautiful place to spend time in Lombok, this is it. If I could give 6 stars, I would. I can't wait to return.
title: Absolute perfection in every way

text:
My wife and I were lucky to be the first few to stay in this wonderful resort which opened in May. It has all the luxuries you would want for a relaxing holiday. The infinity pool, the great room and comfy bed, it's all just as you see in the pics. An eco-friendly place that  will serve as a lovely getaway for you and your partner, close to Sengigi but above it all so you have a bit of peace and quiet and did I mention the killer view from the top. If you want non-stop connectivity and hustle and bustle, this is not the place for you but then again you probably won't appreciate the set-up they have here which is pretty special.

In addition, Jean-Paul and Nury are lovely people who give a personal touch to the service and always ready to talk and advise with a smile but never too much so you'll always get your privacy. Nury is an AMAZING chef and we even ditched our plans of going down to the cheap warungs below because we enjoyed her cooking so much. She may be indonesian but having spent some time in europe makes a killer pasta and I absolutely love her beef burger. We had a lovely time with them and look forward to meeting them again on our next trip!
title: The Peak of your Lombok Holiday

text:
This hotel is small giving more attention to each customer who is treated as a friend. Is perfectly located allowing to see the whole coast while one's swiming in a beautiful pool after having a varied and nutritive breakfast. At night, the lights create a scenic effect making the place gain a different beauty based on ellegance and excellence. I highly recommend this place and in Lombok I wouldn't stay elsewhere.

Congratulations for such quality and beauty!
title: Excellence!

text: The location of the resort, the rooms, the atmosphere/ambiance, and the hosts are simply wonderful!!! This was absolutely one of the best stay I ever experienced, and I've been living in different  Asian countries in the last 5 years. Rooms are wonderfully decorated, very private and the view is simply stunning. But even better is the service provided by the hosts, Mr Jean Paul and his wife. They are such a nice people, I can hardly describe how kind and helpful they have been! we had breakfast every morning served on the table outside our rooms,  they helped to arrange car rental, they let us paying in both rupias and USD, and they even made us a surprise and came to pick us up at the airport at 9 pm for free!! we initially booked only 1 night but of course we stayed for the entire length of our stay (just 3 nights unfortunately)! Really Looking forward to go back again!!!! Thanks again Jean Paul!!!!
title: SIMPLY WONDERFUL!!!!! one of the best places I ever stayed!!!!

text:
Das Hotel liegt abseits auf einem Hügel, mit einem wahnsinnigen Ausblick Richtung Meer, Stadt und dem Sonnenuntergang. 
Das Hotel ist optimal für Entspannung und Erholung, Ruhe und Rückzug. 
Vom Check-In, der von den Hotelbesitzern Jean-Paul und Nury, persönlich gemacht wird, der Einrichtung der Zimmer, den Angestellten bis hin zum Abendessen, das Nury selbst kocht, ist alles stimmig, einmalig und einfach toll. 
Die zwei Infinity Pools, die Anlage als auch die Zimmer sind in einem hervorragendem Zustand, werden täglich gereinigt und gesäubert. Die 5 Zimmer, die zum The Puncak gehören, sind alle Richtung Meer ausgerichtet, im Bett liegend kann man über den Pool Richtung Meer schauen. Einfach traumhaft. 
Das Frühstück war reichhaltig, gesund, frisch! Das Frühstück wird direkt auf der Terrasse serviert, es gibt eine große Auswahl an verschiedenen Produkten. 
Das Abendessen empfiehlt sich ebenfalls im The Puncak einzunehmen. Es gibt eine kleine, aber sehr feine Auswahl. Von Salat zu Suppen bis hin zu Burger oder Fischspeisen sowie ´local food´ findet sich alles auf der Karte. Die Speisen sind frisch zubereitet. Wert legen die Besitzer auf gute Qualität der Lebensmittel. 

Auch der tägliche Kontakt mit Jean-Paul und Nury, die stets ein gutes Gefühl für Nähe/ Präsenz aber auch Distanz hatten, war informativ, herzlich und authentisch. Wir haben viel über den Alltag dort, das Leben und die Kultur erfahren. 

Für uns war es die perfekte Auszeit nach der Reise durch Java und Bali. Hervorzuheben ist die familiäre und persönliche Atmosphäre. Es gibt keinerlei Kritikpunkte. Wir haben bisher noch kein vergleichbares Hotel besucht. 
Wir werden wieder kommen!
title: Perfekte Erholungsoase für eine Auszeit zum stressigen Alltag

Liebe Gäste,
Hello L6553DUpatrickm,


Vielen Dank für Ihren Beitrag.

Wir wünschen Ihnen alles Gute


Jean-Paul und Nury

title: Perfectas vacaciones

text:
Sehr schöne und gepflegte Unterkunft mit Traumblick und leckerem Frühstück direkt ans Zimmer. :)
Wir haben die Zeit sehr genossen. Wer die Ruhe liebt ist hier genau richtig. 
Wir bedanken uns sehr bei Jean-Paul und dem Personal. Sie waren sehr hilfsbereit und nett.
Schöner hätten wir es auf Lombok nicht haben können. :)
title: Wundervoller Aufenthalt !

text: È raro trovare una struttura come questa che riesca a mettere insieme standard alberghieri di grande eccellenza degni di un cinque stelle con il calore e l'intimità di un piccolo albergo nel quale sembra di essere a casa propria. Jean Paul e Nury sono i due padroni di casa che, in modo discreto, si prendono cura di ogni dettaglio del soggiorno alla guida di uno staff veramente impeccabile. Per non parlare della location che è paradisiaca: sulla collina retrostante Senggigi, le camere si affacciano tutte sul mare. Svegliarsi la mattina con queste enormi vetrate aperte sull'oceano che separa Lombok da Bali è un'esperienza indescrivibilei. Nota finale: non sarà un problema se una sera non vorrete scendere in città. Trattenetevi al Puncak e cenate sul bordo della piscina: la cucina di Nury non vi farà sentire la nostalgia dei ristoranti più noti della città. Grazie JP e Nury del bellissimo soggiorno che abbiamo avuto da voi.
title: Un piccolo angolo di paradiso sulla collina di Senggigi

owner_response.text:
Cari ospiti,
Dear Francesco P,

Grazie mille per la tua grande descrizione del tuo soggiorno a The Puncak.

Cordiali Saluti,


Jean-Paul & Nury
